product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I bought for my son. He always wants a camera of his own. Now he finally owns one. It is of very nice color and is really easy to operate. The quality of the image is decent. He is absolutely in love with it and has taken lots of pictures for his toys. He is excited for tomorrow's vocation because he wants to take pictures of the beach and the sea.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I am satisfied both with the underwater photos and video, I also used it above the water a dozen times during a cavern exploration.The quality is Okay and there is no blurriness, noise or bad quality to the image or video. By saying Ok I mean that for this price I expected it to be a lot worse but to my surprise it far exceeded my expectations. It's a good camera for its price,

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Purchase this for my trip. Did a water test to it on my tub. No water leak to the camera.  Everything is in fuction order  and good picture under water. Will test it later in real life.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: So the piece that attracted me to this package versus the other Canon packages on Amazon was the 3 included lenses. I should have known better. It DOES come with the 1 Canon kit lens. The other 2 lenses are XIT brand and the two of them together can be purchased for less than $20. They actually make the pictures worse. Also, just to note, these are not stand alone lenses. They screw onto the front of the lens like a filter would. These are completely not usable for any kind of quality pictures. An average point and shoot camera takes higher quality pictures than you will get through these lenses.,If this is your first DSLR, the kit provides a decent value. All of the components are cheap, but will give you an idea if those are things you will use and should replace with better versions.,The camera itself is (so far) awesome. The camera alone would have been a 5 star purchase. The package alone would be a 2 star purchase. The way it's listed and pictured is deceptive. Overall, it's worth the $10 over just the camera, but be sure to keep your expectations low.,All the included components are as follows:,$10.69 xit macro lens xt58wab,$8.93 xit telephoto lens xt2x58,$19.75 vivitar large gadget bag,$22.46 xit tripod xt60trb,$4.50 vivitar 4in pocket tripod,$9.16 transcend 16gb flash card,$16.99 transcend 32gb flash card,$8.68 xit remote shutter release,$4.93 xit SD/microSD card reader,$7.46 pro series digital filter set,$3.95 lens cap keeper (stick on),$2.94 xit universal screen protector,$3.99 xit digital ultraviolet filter,$3.00 vivitar cleaning kit and card wallet,$14.95 slave flash,Total accessories: $142.38,$449 Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera Kit with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II Lens (Black)

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: First things first: I love the camera. I have been using it for about a month now, and it has been wonderful. It is a fantastic first time camera and does a great job at helping you learn it. The rating is due to what comes with the camera, so please beware.,Pros: The SD cards alone provide good value, as they can get expensive as you need bigger cards, for a first-timer, and as long as you aren't shooting raw+jpeg like I am, you won't need anything else. Also helps to mention you get a sd card wallet and a usb reader/writer. The uv and other filters are also nice if you want to use filters in your shots, when I first started out I was using a uv filter on my kit lens. I have since bought a much better lens, and do not use a filter anymore. The cleaning kit is very handy, I have no problems there but also bought a professional cleaning kit. The mini tripod is quite cute and has been handy a few times, beware, I have had trouble getting it to hold up my camera sturdy enough with anything other than the kit lens. As stated above, the camera and everything it comes with is good. It also comes with a remote shutter which is very nice as well. I tried it out with my silly little tripod and was pleased with the result.,Cons: My biggest issue with my purchase is it sounded like you are getting two extra lenses with the purchase. You're not. The picture you see of the three lenses grouped together: the bigger one is the kit lens and the two extras next to it are them. They are not lenses, they do not attach to the camera. I would call these "lens extensions", as they screw onto your kit lens like a uv filter does. They are also 100% worthless, please take it from someone who has already tried them, and then bought other lenses and compared the difference. I would upload the bad pictures they took, but have since deleted them out of my library. The bag it comes with is incredibly small, and barely fits all of your accessories, heaven forbid you go and get more equipment to add to it. I have since purchased a backpack that I can grow into, and the bag is now a spare parts bag. The bigger tripod is a cheap plastic, and while it is just fine for indoor photography and videos, I wouldn't dare use it on a windy day taking landscape shots. The flash could be a pro or con depending on your personal thoughts. It is not an ETTL, meaning that you have to manually adjust your settings to match the flash and how it fires, the camera will not do it for you. It also is completely stationary, it is brighter than the built-in flash, which is better for outdoor shots that you need to light up. I can imagine it would be difficult for a beginner, it was difficult for me.,Conclusion: If I had known better at the time, I would have either spent less money to get a kit without "lenses" or spent a little bit more to get real lenses included in the kit. The camera itself and the SD cards provide wonderful value, but I would not make this purchase again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Will keep this review short and simple. This is my first camera, this bundle has everything you need if you're into photography. This, in my opinion is a great camera to start learning on. Super easy to use and very high quality pictures. I've been out shooting the past few days and have taken some amazing pictures. Worth every penny! If you're thinking about buying it, do it! You won't be disappointed.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: This is a great camera. Easy to use and take great pictures. The accessories are useful. However, the flash is not compatible with this camera (see alert). I read that this flash is not compatible with the camera. Therefore, they are sending accessories that are not compatible in a bundle which is not fair. Other than the accessories, this is a great camera.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: If you are looking for a great entry level camera and kit for photography look no further! They say that a picture can speak a thousand words. I will let the pictures do just that.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I highly recommend this product!,I am no pro when it comes to photography, but I do want my own slr and want to learn! This is perfect for a beginner like me, it came with so much accessories. Love it!,It came in a box, of course! Lol see picture below, everything has its own case. Seriously, everything a beginner would need is here.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: We love this camera. I bought it for my wife and after a couple days of learning how to use it she was taking professional quality photos.  The camera is easy to use and comes with everything you need to get started.  The bundle package is a good deal.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Bought this set for the youth group at the local church. Works great but my only complaint is that the extra flash that comes with this bundle does not work!?!? Why would the seller even sell it with this camera if it does not work?? I saw other reviews stating the same thing but I Figured ok maybe I will be the lucky one that has one that will work, nope. But that will not deter me from using this camera. 4 stars. Good camera with a dollar store extras. Dollar tree at that. If you find this review helpful click the helpful button.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: This camera is an excellent choice for a step up from point-and-shoot, or a first camera for a novice DSLR.  It's fully automatic but you can gradually take creative control of every aspect of your photography as you become more comfortable with the settings and features.  The tiny instruction manual included in the package gives just the basics and can be frustrating, but download the PDF file and there are your clear directions, step by step and in color.  For an experienced amateur photographer some of the items included in the kit will be redundant (who doesn't have at least two tripods?) but buying the camera, lenses, flash and cards separately would be more expensive than what you receive in this packed bundle.  The only thing I would change is one feature of its WiFi capabilities.  Unlike the Canon SX60HS, it can't wirelessly download to the hard drive of a computer.  You would use your cable or card reader.  But it's just a minor annoyance.  It can easily send your photos to any mobile device.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Absolutely love my camera 110%.... The quality is great and not to mention all the accessories it comes with that are very handy. I am really happy with this camera and I am looking to buy another lens just to take more awesome shots.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: This was a gift for a young family member. It is easy to use, and takes very good photos. My only minor complaint is that it's tricky to learn how to use only a slight pressure on the shutter button to depress it halfway in order to focus before depressing all the way to release the shutter. It's mostly a learning problem, but the key is for the user to wait for the on-screen focusing aid to change to green before depressing the shutter all the way down.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: My old camera was wearing out, not taking clear picture, so I got this Nikon to replace it. Cost, battery type and reviewers' comments were big factors in my choice. I am thrilled with this little dynamo! Long battery life and sharp pictures. I create textile art, and this camera shows every stitch in crisp detail. Highly recommended.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I love how the so called " professional " critics rip this camera. It works great, takes great pics and is super convienient. Bring4  AA batteries. 2 go in the camera, two for spares, and you can go to the moon and back without worrying about recharging.  But thanks to there stupid snobbery, they are making these types of cameras obsolete in the market.  Soon we will have to pay 300 bucks or more for a bunch of features and accessories the common photographer will never use.  Hoard these A10's when you can folks, these perfect little cameras will soon be gone

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I think it's a pretty good camera for the price. It is so small it is almost difficult to handle. It fits in my shirt pocket. Do buy the cable; I had a very small USB cable for my old Canon camera but it would not fit the Nikon. It takes a while to get the hang of pushing the shutter release halfway, then pausing, then pressing it home. I think the people who complained of blurry pix were pressing the shutter all at once. One function I like is you can reduce a shot to an email-able size (640x480) in the camera. It makes a copy.,I selected this camera mainly because it takes AA batteries. I have since purchased a Canon PowerShot ELPH 190 which is almost twice the price but it has wifi.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: This camera would be great if it was for taking pictures of people and places that are willing to stay still for 5 to 10 seconds, but, since it was purchased to take pictures of children, most of the pictures do not come out well.  Let's face it, asking a child to stay still for more than a second does not work well. AND, action shots, forget it!!!  Even taking a picture of a child's triumphant moment, lost every time.  And, two pictures in a row, your kid will be done with that and moved on to something new by the time it is ready to take a second photo.  Overall, pretty disappointing.,This camera is just way too slow.  I am planning on replacing it, but need to find something under $100 that is a better fit.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Good value for the price.  I wanted a small, cheap camera for travel.  Wish it came with a cable for connection to a computer.  Apparently Nikon uses a lot of proprietary cables.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Great camera. I have owned Nikon film cameras for years. There are no better cameras in the world despite what Canon owners profess ! This was a replacement for an earlier model Coolpix which my wife carried in her purse for 7 years. The A10 is a more sophisticated camera with better features.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: These are good quality cameras that last. I usually purchase the L32 for work but it is getting hard to find it available. The Coolpix L32 (,) has a 20.1 mega pixels sensor and this one has a 16.1 mega pixels sensor and that makes a bit of a difference in picture quality but if this is something you would notice, you would not be getting a camera of this type.,There are many cameras of this type that are either inexpensive and of bad quality or great quality but very expensive. This camera falls in a vanishing category of great quality at a reasonable price. This camera will take great quality pictures at 16.1 mega pixels and it is important to note that the zoom is optical which means that you will not give up any of the resolution when you zoom in. If your goal is to get the best quality you can get, and this camera does not make you happy, I do not think that the L32 would make you much happier so you will have to move to professional cameras that have detachable lenses and you are looking at many times the price.,There is something that you will not like about this camera and the only reason I gave it 4 stars. The world is moving fast to 4K video resolution but unfortunately this camera cannot even do 1080p recording. Considering that most cell phones today have 1080p video recording capabilities, you would think that a device that all it does is camera functions, would at least have the ability to record 1080p video. If you are looking for a quality camera that is easy to use and you want it to last, this camera is highly recommended. But be sure first that you just need a camera for pictures and not for video. This may be the reason why these cameras are at the brink of extinction, they are great picture cameras but our mobile devices have spoiled us so much that we do not want just a picture camera any longer. When we consider buying a camera, we do it because we want something better than what we already have in our pocket and that usually means that we are looking for optical zoom and quality lenses with quality video capabilities.,If you are still interested in this camera, here are some things that you may want to know:,1) It has an easy to view 2.7" screen.,2) Operation is very simple and the menus are easy to figure out without having to read a manual.,3) It uses 2 AA batteries that you can buy everywhere. I had cameras with rechargeable batteries that go dead if I do not use the camera for a few months or their charger is proprietary and when it is broken or lost, it costs a lot to replace it. I love the simplicity of just putting 2 new commonly used batteries and be good to go.,4) It takes the full size SD memory card which means that you can just put in an adapter (many micro SD cards come with a free adapter) and turn it to a micro SD card while you will not have to throw away your old full size cards.,As for durability, we use cameras for the nursing staff to take pictures of patients and enter them to our electronic health record (EHR) software. We also use them for employee badges. Although we do not need high resolution pictures for these functions, when we get the less expensive cameras, they do not last for more than a few months. I always find them dead or the battery compartment door broken and held by rubber bands. So I have been replacing those $30.00 to $50.00 cameras with the Coolpix L32 and this A10 and I do not have any problems anymore.,Note that this camera does not come with a USB cable unless you purchase the bundle and it has a non standard connector. You can either use a USB card reader like this one ,, or you can buy the USB cable here, ,, which costs about 12 bucks at the time of this review.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I've owned two other Coolpix cameras in the past.  I always liked them because of their ease of use and how well they worked, and the quality of the pictures.  All that is changed now.  The picture quality is terrible, many pictures are unstable, there are less features on this model than on the one from five years ago.  Nikon should look up some of their old designs and go back to them.  This camera is garbage.  And it costs about the same as the ones I bought five years ago which were far superior.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I purchased this camera [with the bundled USB CABLE] through amazon PRIME as a Christmas gift for my daughter. After the camera arrived I was notified by curt email they were out of the usb cable - about five days before Christmas. When I went to amazon to look at the order to figure out what had happend (and  to see if they had credited my account for the part they were not including) they had completely removed the portion of my order that had included the cable?!! So, now I get to track down another cable.  Then I found out that all the usb cables for Nikon are proprietary. You have to use their cable. Then I noticed there is no memory card included with the camera - this is my mistake not catching this before I ordered it. Then, in trying to call amazon to discuss... well, the Help button provides no HELP. It's an endless loop to keep you from actually reaching anyone. Shame on amazon. I have been a very good customer and a Prime member.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I am excited about my camera . Unfortunately I have not had and opportunity to use it yet . My friend has one and she loves hers . I have seen here pictures.So I will be sure to enjoy mind. Check back with me in late September . Thanks

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I got this a gift for my son to take on his trips he loves it

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I needed a camera to take the place of my 19 year old Olympus.  This Canon stepped right up.  It had all the features I needed and combined with the value pack, I couldn't go wrong.  I'm very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it if you're looking for a simple operating camera with great picture quality.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Camera works well and really liked the bundle. Bought for work surveying poles.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I am just setting up my new camera and the instructions are clear and concise.  I have snapped a few "test" photos and they look great.,Very pleased with everything so far and looking forward to taking this camera on our forthcoming vacation.  Thanks for the quick shipping and excellent service.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: This was the perfect gift for our grand daughter's 14th bday.  All of the extras that came with the camera were an added bonus.  The camera takes great pictures and is easy to use.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This product was purchased because of maker's reputation, and it turned out to be a wise choice.  The supplier deserves an A+ in processing, as it arrived a day early, giving me an extra day to wrap it for Valentine's Day.  My wife loves her grandchildren, and now her own special camera to take pictures of them. Great job!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Got it for my 13 YO daughter. She says close pictures turn out well but zooming leaves things a little blurry. She loves the quality of the videos. Overall she is happy with it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Good price

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I love this little camera. It's so small and easy to fit into a pocket or outside pocket of a purse. Amazingly good quality for such a small device.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I sent the camera back.  Spent 30 minutes trying  to put the wrist strap on.  Called Canon and Amazon for help.  Tried using thread, dental floss, a needle, and bent paperclip...NOTHING would get that strap through that TINY recessed clip.  Terrible design.  The strap should have been installed by Canon.  Sorry but I ran out of patience.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: It's a nice little camera. Wish I would've researched it a little more, would've liked to be able to direct connect it to the computer to download the pictures. I only used the card reader one time before I had to get a new one, it wouldn't work after one use.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I'm very happy with this purchase. Everything came as described. Very reasonable price.  Update after a month of use: This camera is very easy to use.  The battery holds a charge forever.  I'm a preschool teacher and I use it every day. It takes great pictures!  I'm so pleased!  .

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The product arrived within the time promised. I received all the pieces I would need to use including an SD/SDHC card and card reader. The camera is very light weight and easy to use.  Just point and click or point, zoom and click and you get a pretty good picture.  As an amateur photographer this product suits me just fine.  I would easily recommend it to others.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This is to replace our older Canon Powershot. WE bought it to take on vacation next month so I am anticipating that it will work even better than the older model.  We love the smaller size and the great pictures that come from this camera

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Camera arrived on time with all the things needed to make it functional (battery charger, lens cleaner, card reader...). I took it on a trip to mexico and the battery lasted for 4 days and the pictures were really good...during the daylight ..Please note if you are looking to take a lot of pictures in the dark this may not be your best bet as the camera has trouble with autofocus when the flash is involved -- great camera for the price point and good service from the vendor

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I bought this camera as a Chrismas gift for my nephew to take pictures of his new baby. I wanted something for them that was easy to use, and portable enough to grab and go. I thought it was a great deal. It shipped and arrived much earlier than expected. So far it has worked out great!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The battery stopped charging/will not work within 5 months of ordering and that was after purchasing an additional memory card reader because the one that came in the kit never worked. All around, it feels like a waste of money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This camera was purchased as a gift & is well loved by the recipient. I recommend this company, camera was received on time.  On to taking great pictures & videos......

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This is a wonderful little camera that you can take everywhere in your pocket. It takes good photos, and is,very easy to use. I have had a Cannon Powershot for years - this is just my newest one.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I cannot begin to tell you how much I love this camera. It's so amazing. It makes me look like I know what I'm doing, because it has so many automatic settings. Incredible zoom. Fantastic macro shots. Special settings for every type of scene. Eventually, I'll learn how to use the manual settings. The camera is compact and light-weight. I carried it for a week while hiking and was able to take amazing scenery shots and immediately switch to macro mode to get a picture of a spider web, all without having to stop and switch lenses (or carry those extra lenses with me.) I love, love this camera!,(I took this picture of the blood moon on the automatic setting, hand-held.)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had a Panasonic FZ70 digital camera for at over 3 years now & it still works, but not as good as before & I pre-ordered this Panasonic [FZ80] a few months ago & recently received it. It takes the same battery as the FZ70 does. It has the same CMOS sensor & 60X optical zoom lens set up as the FZ70. It has 18.1 megapixels & a few minor internal tweaks, including some sort of update to their Venus processor compared to the prior FZ70 model; which is suppose to create slightly better images. Photo qualities so far with this camera seems pretty good & on par with the prior model, FZ70. Daytime outdoor photos are good, but in lower light conditions, the pictures are very grainy...as expected. Indoor photos with the flash are great. Video qualities seems pretty good with this camera also...indoors or out. This camera has full auto & manual controls, self timer, burst photo modes, uses SD/SDHC cards & comes with a battery, but no actual external charger. You have to charge this battery in the camera connected to an AC outlet. I would get an  external battery charger[s] & several extra batteries for this camera. Battery life seems a little worse than the prior FZ70....maybe 300 photos with no flash & about 100 photos using mostly flash...not very good, but not really too bad. The lens hood from the FZ70 fits this camera too. You do not get a lens hood with this camera. This camera  resembles the FZ70 with some minor exterior cosmetic changes, but both viewfinders are upgraded which are much better than the view finders on the FZ70.  Plus, the rear viewfinder is now a touch screen type, something the FZ70 lacked & that viewfinder is still built into the camera & cannot swivel or tilt. Wifi connection possible with this digital camera & the wifi options is in the camera's menu. This camera can take 4K videos & photos. You can also turn that feature off easily. As with the FZ70 camera, you can use an external flash on this camera too. Really, this camera's upgrade over the FZ70 mostly is 4K video/photo, using OLED viewfinders, touch screen rear OLED viewfinder, 2 more megapixels, wifi compatible, a bit more cleaner cosmetically speaking & slightly upgraded internal Venus processor. Menu layout on this camera is as easy to navigate...typical Panasonic easy to navigate menu system. Really a decent digital camera, but still can take a good photo or video. A modest upgrade from the older Panasonic FZ70 Lumix & can probably give the Nikon P-600 or Canon's SX-60-HS cameras both a run for their money now. I would rate it 4 out of 5 stars mostly because it's just a modest upgrade from the FZ70, lacked an external battery charger or lens hood and photo qualities are basically about the same [not a bad thing there].

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The challenge for this camera like most bridge cameras with small sensors is image quality, especially  because of its phenomenal zoom range which can be increased even further with reduced pixelization. But, with this camera, contrary to the implied suggestion of most "professional" reviewers, there is much you can do to seriously increase image quality and have your camera pull well ahead of other super zooms, It is done both by camera settings and technique. Additionally, by processing, if you chose to go that far. You will need to work hard in order to achieve superior results full of color, sharpness, contrast and low noise, but it is doable even without RAW processing, notwithstanding the stunning wide to telephoto zoom range. To accomplish this, work carefully with the camera settings, pay close attention to get the optimal exposure, keep the ISO down, get the "hang" of the stabilization system, use spot focusing and area selection, and then use a tripod, monopod or brace like a shooter as I do. Finally, to do even more, shoot RAW and in processing go after sharpness and noise reduction, perhaps with an add-on noise reduction program like Topaz which plugs into Lightroom. The results from doing these things vs not and just snapping your shots are simply huge and stunning -- night vs. day. Just a word to the wise, if image quality is your real concern.,Update 9/15/14 to my last comment,For objects in shade/overcast, I use "Vivid" +1 contrast, +1 sharpness, 0 saturation, -2 noise reduction. For objects in bright sunlight or bright enough and nearer by, I use "Natural" -1 contrast, -1 sharpness, -1 saturation and -2 noise reduction. I switch between the two using the F2 button by having the Vivid settings stored as a custom setting and the Natural settings as the way the camera is set up. Pushing two buttons gets me back and forth quickly. Still playing with the settings, but these are pretty ballpark.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had an old FZ150 I used for micro work for my 1,000s of web-site photos, it lasted 8 years ? or more,. but after a drop, it would no longer focus.,I bought this FZ80 to replace it, after 2 days of using it , I am returning it, the view finder is to small, the pictures are not crisp and the focus if not great and iI feel it is not made well  enough for the Lumix name brand.,I have ordered a FZ300 in hopes it is better built .,3 stars I want better pictures and better built then this model.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: What I like: The X60 zoom is amazing and rare; the camera is relatively light for easy travel; can do some manual settings and raw images.,What I don't like: When zooming far way, need to zoom in gradually to establish focus, else would get out of focus. Also, when zooming in low light, the auto shutter speed is slow, causing blurring images. For example, in events with professional lighting, such as a big concert, I could take decent pictures of the lit stage from very far away. However, for indoor events with no professional lighting, such as school events, zooming from far away would likely have blurry pictures, unless I try to snap only when everyone is still.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: For a camera with such a large zoom, you would think the body would be sized for two handed operation, but the left side of the body has little or no lip to grasp the camera without obscuring the LCD screen. I bought a leather case which extends the sides of the camera slightly, allowing for better two handed grip when using. Other then that the professional reviews align with my findings and use. Quick auto focus in good light and price point.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Fantastic camera. The only 'issue' is common to a lot of cameras these days. It's got so many 'smart' options sometimes it tries to take the picture 'it' thinks is better and I have to hunt around to find a more manual mode to get it to take the picture I want it to.,It is a bit hard to take star-pictures because it keeps trying to either adjust my time to get more light or take pictures and average them.,But that's a limitation more of the slightly higher learning curve to really use this camera. The stability at full zoom is great, much better,than the Nikon, for example.,The lens is awesome, If you wide angle, be careful. It will fish-eye if you angle 'up or down' too much. Also,the other thing that is a limitation of most cameras that offer a '3d' feature is the 3d is not very useful because it only works,at 'max wide angle view', meaning distant scenery, which really never has much depth. 3d up close with the differences in depth,is what I wanted, but it disables the 3d if you zoom in at all or if what you're looking at is fairly close. So the twin-lens cell phone,that does 3d actually takes better 3d pictures for close up stuff.,Otherwise I love it. The ring mount is 55 mm so it's fairly easy to use existing lens adapters and filters or get a ring adapter for it.,The camera battery life is great and with an inexpensive 32 gb card it takes a lot of pictures and a lot of video. The sound recording,is also very good.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I am having a good time using this camera. My primary use is to capture birding images. I want great detail for confirming ID. I am not a professional photographer and am not able to evaluate images to that extent, but for what I have taken so far, they do really well and blow up decently. Most of my shots are at full zoom.,It is a bit noisy when zooming. I am still getting use to where the controls are. If it has a primary fault - it has too many features and learning to use them all will take some time. I shoot in Manual and Shutter priority mostly and some of the control could be smoother. Learning how to manually focus is cumbersome, hopefully I'll get smoother at it and upgrade the rating when I am convinced it does all.,The manual is a bit complicated. Wish it was a bit faster (shutter/f-stop) but who has ever had a camera/lens that was fast enough?

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I really bought this because I had a Lumix 10 years ago and that worked well for me then.,Now, this is a step up except for the lens,  which used to always be a Leica.  I guess for this,price point under $300, you have to give up something.,For my use , it suites me just fine.  Took a little bit to get used to the new AF macro, as I do a lot of shoots with macro.,Wasn't as precise as the older one when it came to the focus point.  Almost better to do MF macro sometimes.  But once I adjusted, the shots came out much better.,If I have to really nit pick, some of the button placements are naturally in the wrong places.,I have hit several of them on accident when moving around to get different angles on a shot..,Again that will be more of an adjustment for me, but still something for the manufacturer to consider.,I know they got a lot of things shoved into this camera, so button placement area is limited to begin with.,So maybe some of the buttons we don't have to access all the time should be recessed with a cover over them.,Overall though, I am liking this camera more and more.,Let's hope it last as long as my previous one.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: First of all, I'm not a photographer. But I'm totally in love with this camera. An image speaks more than a thousand words, no? Well... lets see 🤓,This review ys for FZ82 (I can't urdenstando why Amazon allows to put all reviews together, for two different models)

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I  got tired of taking photos with my phone , i wanted a real camera , that had a real zoom . I have a number of very expensive  SLR's but they are heavy  to carry around all the time . This is the perfect mix of convenient  and efficient . To look at copies of your photos , all you have to do is simply take the card out of  the camera  and put it into your computer , and you have them ready to transfer to your hard drive . plus if you want you can use a cable  like you would do  with a phone . it is a cheap camera , but it takes expensive photos  . it doesn't do the same as my  $3000.oo  NIKON's , and the reviews here  seem to think it should . but to take  great snap shot photos it is as good as any cell phone camera , and it very small  easy to carry  thus you are going to  take more photos that you would not do other wise , even with a cell phone camera . For what it is designed for , it gets 5 gold stars

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I wanted a small camera to take everyday pictures with that would fit in my purse.  I wasn't happy with my low quality iPhone 5 pics - this is a great quality photo for the price.  I'll include two pics - one taken with the camera and one taken with my iPhone.  Same lighting

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I couldn't believe it. I tried to download the photos to my computer and I couldn't unless I downloaded a Sony Cloud program. Then I saw that the program was trying to take over all my photos in one folder on my PC. I stopped the program and sent the camera back to Amazon. They don't say anthing about this in the online description - it's B.S.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I have had 4 or 5 Sony digital cameras over the years and they have been great.  When I broke the screen on the last model (totally my fault) I was confident that Sony was the way to go.  A quick google search listed this model as the 2018 best point and shoot under $100 and I was sold.  However, I was deeply disappointed when it arrived.  Honestly I don’t care too much whether a camera has 8MP or 20MP (I rarely enlarge photos).  What I do care about is how long it takes to take the picture.  I hate trying to get a picture and by the time the camera focuses and shoots the subjects (usually kids or animals) have already lost patience.  This camera is way too slow; after every picture there was about a 3-4 second delay when the screen went blank.  Most pictures came out blurry.  Even changing modes didn’t help.  For those who care, this camera felt flimsy, my other Sony was lightweight but had a solid metal casing.  I might have got a lemon but I am guessing Sony got lazy with so few point and shoot cameras being used these days. So I am returning this camera, I haven’t decided on a replacement yet, but this is not worth $80.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: It delivers on being a high definition, easy to use point-and-click camera. Its Programmed Exposure mode is perfect for warm photos and scenery while its Auto Tracking mode is best for taking clear crisp movement shots. I was able to take shots of cars speeding along the road with zero blur.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera 2 years ago, and it is JUST OKAY. I have to hold it very steady and even then the shutter speed seems too slow as I have a lot of blurred pics. There is  one small thing that there is really no need for and that the USB cable is not standard and I had to buy a spare just to connect to a PC or charge; so you have to use their cable and not the same one you would use for your phone or Echo, Etc. If I had to do it all over I would have selected another camera, and would recommend trying to get something better because blurred photos can be very disappointing.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: It seems that point and shoot cameras are going the way of the dinosaur thanks to smart phones, but I still like dedicated products.  I bought this little jewel specifically for going on a vacation in the very near future.  It will save wear and tear on my smart phone.  The camera images are SHARP and there is very little learning curve involved.  It is compact and easy to handle.  I purchased the 3 year protection plan at a very cheap price.  For $102 (including tax and protection plan) out the door, this is a sure fire win.  Buy one or two at this price!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: My old digital compact camera didn't have a USB charging cord and we were on our way to a once-in-a-lifetime tour of Scotland, so I ordered this at the last minute. Great little camera takes wonderful snaps. Rode in top pocket of my pack through trains, planes, busses, taxis, etc. and never a hiccup. Really simple to operate. Just what I needed!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I am an amateur photographer and own three DSLR cameras with a selection of lenses. However that collection does not eliminate the need for a handy item for just daily needs. I keep this one especially in my car's glove box as a reserve for occasions which require something better than my cell phone camera. For that purpose it meets my expectations and even exceeds it. Yet, this is still a snap shot device with a relatively low price tag and therefore  a DSLR level quality (like background blurring, high shutter speed, high level of low light performance etc.)should not be expected.,Pros:,-Lightweight slim and  stylish design: It can fit in small spaces and look and feel like a high quality item.,-USB charging ability: That is one of the selling points for me. I keep it in my car and I don't want to run out of power any time or go through the hassle of removing the battery and charging it separately ,which requires carrying the charging adapter all the time and also the ability to plug in that adapter. Instead. all I do is to connect it to my 12V car USB charger and it pretty quickly accumulates good amount of charge level... It comes with a wall adapter (5V 0.5A) which connects to a detachable USB cable (so you can use the cable and attach it to any USB charger). But be careful about the USB cable. The standard USB-micro B cable that charges most mobile devices do not work for this type. If you need a replacement or an extra you need to buy a USB-UC E6 cable.,-Easy menu mode: Practicality should be the main focus in a snapshot device and even my grandfather could get through this menu. One of the most user-friendly interfaces I have seen so far.,-Panoramic shoot ability: That was a surprise for me. I had not read the product description in detail before buying and that was such a handy function. I used to take panoramic photos by taking tens of photos with my DSLR and stiching them with a software which was both difficult and time consuming. This function does it instantly and produces comparable quality photos.,-5X optical zoom: When it comes to zooming, in photographic terms, the less is often more. The best lenses even come with no zoom at all. However for a practical item like this, zoom is essential and 5X is a good range for the optical zoom (it is also critical that you compare the optical zoom capacities of devices and not the digital zoom before making a judgement.),-Image quality: As I said above, it does not match the quality of a DSLR and I don't care about the high pixel size either. For cameras with small sensor sizes like snapshots, it is actually better to get a low MP device for sharper images, but this one not bad at all especially in daylight. HD Video quality is also good but again depends on the light...,-Price: the $78 price tag as of august 2014 makes it one of the most affordable snapshot cameras in the market. You can get better deals from time to time but this is quite appealing too.,Cons:,-Low light performance: Again, I want to stress that I am not expecting professional quality from this device, but I found the low light performance moderate at best. The noise was somewhat irritating even with flash.,-Slow shutter speed: It has a continuous shooting mode which is supposed to take multiple frames in a short time as long as the shutter button is depressed. However this device has a long long refractory period between shoots that it is not even worth bothering with that mode. You need to decrease the image quality 3 steps to be able to notice some multiple shooting effect and that is not worth it. So if you wish to take a photo of a flying bird or a running person or a passing by car, you don't have much choice to take multiple photos and decide later.,-Zoom buttons: I like the zoom to be a ring style beneath the shutter button but this is like a plus and minus at the back which is not very convenient.,-No optical viewfinder: This is not a problem for this model only. Most recent cameras sacrifice from an optical viewfinder and all you get is a digital image on the screen to help you adjust your photo before taking it. First of all it does not give the sense of taking a photo but more importantly digital screen viewfinder drains battery and also performs bad in bright light.,-Video focusing sound: While recording video of a closely located object (where there is a constant need to re-adjust autofocusing) and if the surrounding is silent, you can hear the sound of focus adjustments in your recording. But as I said that is only obvious in full silence and for short distance recordings.,Overall you like it or not depends on your expectations. For me it is a handy and adequately performing device with quite useful features. I am happy with this purchase

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: if i could give this camera 0 or negative stars, i would..,DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!,it doesn't adjust to low lighting well, the pictures came out blurry, it took a while for it to capture an image, so you can imagine how difficult it was to try to take good pictures of our infant twins.. we are returning it and looking for something better.,it is also EXTREMELY lightweight, to the point of feeling cheesy.. the screen is extremely small to begin with, just an overall awful camera.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I'm consider myself an amateur photographer, but I like to think I get off some decent shots every so often. After my old camera died after falling from my backpack, I was in the market for a new one like it but with a few extra features.,This camera is really good and takes sharp pictures. There are also many different shooting modes that can yield some very artistic results, especially the Moon Mode which yielded some beautiful shots of... Well... The MOON. The zoom on this camera is like nothing I've ever seen. I've taken shots from miles away and zoomed in so close you would think I was about 20 feet away.,While this camera does have a lot of features, some of them are pretty complex and difficult to understand. I recommend reading the manual online in order to get a full understanding as the included manual is only useful for getting started.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: The camera are pretty cool, but just the built quality feel cheap, made out of plastic. It got flip out screen, good for YouTuber/vlogger. The most surprising me is that it's got MIC input and also wifi connection in which made life easier. Overall, the camera is pretty good for kids or beginner Vloggers. It's a budget video's camera.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Perfect beginners camera for vlogging. I purchased this for my gamer son wanting to launch his YouTube career... smh. I must say for the price it’s awesome. It comes with everything you need minus the tripod and mic, fortunately he already had it ready to go. I attached photos of everything included and I was impressed with the quality. It’s not as heavy as I anticipated but the price tag wasn’t as heavy either... It’s simple to use and he set it up right away without even looking at the manual, kids these days... Very happy with this purchase, now I can rest for a while before he asks for a higher end camera for the holidays. I recommend this for an entry level vlogging camera before having to shell out hundreds for a Canon or something along those lines.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: There are so many clever functions to this camera. I especially like the “selfie” feature which allows you to see yourself forward facing. The screen flips easily in and out. The lens options are nice as well. I like that it came with a velvet carrying case for the extra lens when not in use. The camera itself is very user friendly, but it’s important to note that you need an SD card before use. Some cameras have some internal memory to store pictures, but this camera does not. So maks sure you purchase a card for this at the same time as buying this camera so they come together.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: If you wanna start YouTube and don't wanna spend so much money then this camera is the right fit. I bought this not expecting the best thing ever. I wanted something simple. A camera that can record and make good decent quality, even for YouTube and School projects. When I received the product, I was nervous. Opening it, I found all the needed cables and accessories for the camera. The batteries have decent life, again it's simple. If you want a simple camera, this is it. The retro look gives it an awesome style.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: i bought this camera for myself ,the camera  was really wonderful, it is take great pictures , very clear .I choose this one because it was small and I can take selfies ,so I actually I like it. I love take pictures when t went to the travel .easy to carry for travel abroad ,it doesn’t have many buttons ,it is easy to use, the quality is great and also the camera come with two battery,that’s  great. the battery can use for long hours . I am so happy with it.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Nice camera with great package! Everything inside the box is well protected. It comes with two travel bags, one for camera and the other one for wide angel lens. No worries about running out of barriers since there are two batteries with it. It is very easy to operate. With the wide angle lens you can get more in the photo, which is great! Pictures look more beautiful than without it. Most importantly, this camera takes great photos! Highly recommended!

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Cool camera at a great price,I Are there better cameras? Yes..but they are definitely MUCH MORE EXPENSIVE.,Recommending this to anyone out there looking for a wallet-friendly portable and effective camera

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Handy. and Lightweight. I bought it to use for to take pic to post on my blog. Dont need tobe really expensive one. just a regular one that do the job. This is decent. Work well. Not feel heavy when holding. I like it to be small and light weight.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Used this for the past month on an around country road trip and it served me very well. I love the old fashion look of it! It is sturdy and produced great photos!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Have this camera 3 years now and aside from daylight  shots, the photos taken everyplace else inside, at night etc, never seem to match up to the hellishly good photos taken on my prior Canon cameras where I could aim at the crescent moon and get the moon and the planet Venus I think it is, and it comes out with zoom so clearly.  This camera always seemed to produce tired photos no matter what. I am hoping that a newer Canon, maybe with a little more cash investment will end up being  satisfactory as these onetime reasonable priced and quality filled powershots models are a thing of the past.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera has Digital Image Stabilization which is as ineffective as "digital zoom." Besides the falsity of the description, the lack of effective stabilization makes even worse the slow f3.2 lens at widest opening. Useless unless in bright sunlight. Not worth even the apparently low price offered.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I've tried larger, fancier, more expensive cameras for a number of years, but the ones in my mid-price range never seem to perform as advertised. Plus they're big and awkward to carry around for spontaneous shots. The Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 has been absolutely perfect for my needs. No frills, no bells and whistles, just good photos.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera is nice because it is so small - almost miniature -  but that is all I like.  Battery will not hold a charge.  Assuming this one is defective or old from product being in storage before shipping, but it is unreasonable to ask a buyer to spend $30-$40 more on a new battery when the product is advertised as coming with a battery.  The download process is slow, and way more complicated that is needs to be.  Comparing this one to my old Canon Powershot A480 . . ..This is a low-end model,, so if you are considering Canon go a little higher price and get a better quality camera,  I am disappointed . . ...

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I use this camera everyday for work.  This is my 3rd power shot.  The first is still being used occasionally by my wife, the second got water logged in my pocket so I stole the battery and memory card and pitched the rest, the third is in use and will be for several more years before I destroy it in some unintended stupid way.  Get one, you won't be disappointed.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: It is the best price I could find on an Elph anywhere: my daughter is taking a school trip to DC and we got this for her. The price and value are perfect for the trip. I’m very pleased with the purchase and camera. We aren’t one of those families that give their children cell phones at 10- I’m actually vehemently opposed to children having electronics because they stop learning how to talk to people in person and look at the world they are in. So we needed something for pictures without a phone- because that’s not happening in this house. She’s 13 and doesn’t pack a purse so this is perfect size for her to put in just a small wristlet or something. Overall, perfect solution and amazing first camera for a teen.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This is a fine digital camera for one looking for a very reasonably priced one.  It is very easy to set up and use, and the images it captures are generally admirable.  The instruction guide could have provided more detail, and more expensive cameras should be able to take sharper photos.  But for someone not interested in spending lots of money, this camera is a good buy.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought this camera two months on September 23, 2018, and the bottom fell off.  I have an old Powershot SD1100IS that I have taken to several vacation trip and lasted much longer than this ELPH180.  This new camera I take it to school for my class and been sitting in the back of my backpack.  The backpack is not even full of books.  How can this camera fell apart so fast?  Will try to contact Cannon to get a replacement.  Quality is terrible.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: You can't charge the battery over the USB cord, you have to pop it out and use the special charger.  Getting the battery out and back in, facing the right way is very difficult for older people with limited vision and dexterity.  If I had know, I wouldn't have purchased the camera.  Otherwise, it is a good little camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I was really disappointed when this arrived to find it incredibly light weight and felt rather cheap -- all plastic.  I owned the same model from 5 years ago and LOVED it. I just felt like the gates to the the ports and battery were ready to snap off at a moment's notice on this newer model.  I need something a little more sturdy for my clumsy soul.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My younger daughter (age 6) has taken an interest in nature photography and I wanted to get her a better camera than the advertised 'kid cameras'.  This camera takes good pictures and the LCD screen is ample. It's also easy for her to use. She's dropped it a few times and it's still working like new. She has taken pictures nonstop. You do need an SD card to store photos that isn't provided but that seems standard for most cameras.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My six-year-old son LOVES to borrow my camera to take pictures, and he’s actually pretty good so I decided to get him his own camera as a treat. This is just what I was hoping for for the price: a basic, functional digital camera that is easy for him to use, won’t break the bank, and I won’t have to cry if (when) it gets broken. Picture quality could be better, but as I say it’s perfect for our needs and my son couldn’t be happier with it.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Perfect graduation present for an outgoing senior. Was able to capture all her graduation memories and then give her the camera and the memories before sending her away to college to make more. Very lightweight and compact yet does not lack in quality of photos or features.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Great small camera. I’m not a big bag person I’m more of a small bag person. The size of this camera is great for me since it’s small enough to fit in my small bag. Picture quality is just as great as any larger more expensive camera. So easy to use instructions were easy to follow

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Great quality and great price.  Bought this for grandma because of the strap and carrying case.  I love that if you have used any other camera you are an expert on this one. At 70 she was able to pick this up and go. She found the size perfect. The picture stabilization helped and the smile finder was useful. We added a SD card to the gift and it was a perfect combination.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My son was always taking my phone to take pictures and using up the memory. I decided to try something like this. It is definitely durable as he has dropped it multiple times. It’s easy to turn on and off and snap a picture. The picture screen is clear. It’s the perfect size and fits in a small bag and can even easily fit in your pocket.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I purchased this camera for my seven-year-old. He has been asking for his own camera to take pictures and small videos. This camera is very easy to use and he is able to move through the functions easily. The quality is great for the price that you pay for this camera. He enjoys using it and takes it everywhere! This is an easy to use, affordable and fun camera.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: This is perfect for my son! It’s small & light weight so it’s easy for him to hold in his little hands. It’s easy to use. Love that It has flash & zooms in a lot. Very happy with this purchase.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I find it very handy to keep with me for those times when you really just don’t want to take a lousy picture on your phone. It’s compact, lightweight and easy to use. It’s easy to download photos to your desktop or laptop. It takes good pictures. Good enough to have printed and put in an album or share.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: This camera is perfect for beginners, kids, or even us older folk!  It isn't for super high quality pictures but works awesome for family outings!  It is slim and lightweight so it fits anywhere!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Full disclosure: this is a fantastic little camera and it's cheap. People setting their expectations too high are bound to be disappointed; to do so with this camera and expect it to be National Geographic quality shots are going to be disappointed. It's easy to forget that sometimes we have to start somewhere. That we weren't born natural artists or with a camera or paintbrush in hand. This is a fantastic little starter camera. Here's a couple things about cameras. Megapixels don't matter, zoom does. But when zoom doesn't pan out (rimshot), megapixels matter. So with a high megapixel camera with poor zoom comes along, megapixels matter big time. It allows you to edit and crop without sacrificing photo quality. ISO means how much light gets in the lens, illuminating your subject. Higher the ISO, the more light and less need for a flashlight, torch, lantern, match, etc. This camera takes AA batteries and a full-sized SD card. Pick up a 4-pack of rechargeables and a Class 10 SD card and you are set to go. Take lots and lots of pictures. Get used to the idea of "no more film". Go out there and make mistakes. Take lots of stupid pictures so when that perfect one comes along, you know what to do.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: As others have mentioned, this camera will rapidly consume batteries. Just be sure to buy some rechargeable AA batteries to use with this camera (or find a very good deal on a bulk supply of alkaline cells). Otherwise, the optical quality of this camera is excellent for a point-and-shoot camera in its price range. Color rendition, optical (and digital) zoom, manual settings variety, and ease of use are all great. The battery issue is actually a plus for those searching for a good camera deal, as a small deficiency of that type will make the camera less popular with the typical user, and it will therefore be priced lower to sell off quickly.,You should be able to find a great discount on new or "open box" used cameras. Mine was purchased "used, like new" and it didn't have a scratch on it.,You will need to study and try out the various manual "scene" settings to get exactly the results you desire. If you make the proper setting selections, you'll create images of much higher quality than any phone camera.,So, three points :,1. Buy rechargeable AA batteries for this camera, or buy bulk generic alkaline packs. No Duracell etc. as they last somewhat longer, but are not justified by the much higher price.,2. Stay alert for discounted units.,3. Test out the many image options to acquaint yourself with the camera's capabilities for the best results. The beginning user may be disappointed with the picture quality, but only because they've chosen the wrong setting.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Good value for money on this little camera. I had lost my old camera (it was later found after being digested by the couch), and I needed a new one. I got the thing for one main reason: it looked almost identical to my two-year-old GE camera that was lost. After getting it, it was basically the same product. It operated identically to the GE C1440 W, and i was very happy with the little thing. It takes really good pictures, and make sure to use the mode applications. They really help out. I was in Morocco on a fast bus, but I was still able to take crystal clear pictures without streak using the "sport" function on the camera. While this is clearly the same camera I had before, it still did everything I wanted it to do. Sometimes, the super-zoom function isn't the best (pix get a tad blurry), but, for the money, I can cope with that. Funny how GE and Kodak are somehow connected at the hip. This is/was my old camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Got as a present for my mother for a trip to Italy. Would take 5-10 photos before saying dead batteries. At first my mom switched batteries, then she discovered turning the camera off for an hour worked just as well. I tried contacting the company for support and never got a response.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: It's light, small, and handy, and the photos are fine. But it eats batteries like the cookie monster. I can take maybe 20 photos, turning the camera off between photos, and then the batteries are shot. They shouldn't sell a camera like this, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

product_name: GoPro HERO7 Black Camera + Extra Rechargeable Battery + PNY Elite-X 32GB U3 microSDHC Card (Bundle) - Waterproof Digital Action Camera Touch Screen 4K HD Video 12MP Photos Live Streaming Stabilization
review: The GoPro Hero7 is a great camera from what it has shown through my personal use. First off, I am an avid skier, and stable, well priced camera is very difficult to find, and usually is hard to use. This is not the same with the GoPro.,Firstly, the hyper smooth technology helps make every movement very fluid and smooth, making videos very clear to show to friends and family. Also, it is very strong. I have fallen many times while skiing the slopes, and the GoPro did not even get a scratch. Finally, uploading pictures and videos to your phone has never been easier with any other camera.,The GoPro Hero7 is also great for scuba diving. It takes high quality pictures and videos of the magnificent creatures that you may encounter while scuba diving. Also, the compact size of the camera really helps underwater because anything too bulky becomes unwieldy and awkward underwater.,All in all, the GoPro Hero7 is a great camera for beginners and pros alike.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Bought this for a construction site. Have 2 of them. They say in the office and when anyone needs to take pics, ready to go. We averge 600 photos a week, and the quality of the photos are awesome for what we use it for. When I review on the computer, the high MP makes it easy to zomm with minimal distortion. This camera as saved me thousands of dollars when I can prove my case for correct install and trade damage. Must have for a construction site. And did I mention the ability to just swap AA batteries. Even better, the price. The camera pays for itself on the first picturestep for me.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Bought this camera for a cruise.  It took great pictures and I could carry it in my pocket without feeling it.  With all the features, you can do anything you want.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Great camera! Uses standard alkaline AA batteries not lipo as described.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I just got a new Sandisk high speed SD card (which claims to be extra durable and fast--I can't say if it's durable, but it's definitely fast). For some reason this camera doesn't like it. It's 32GB, which I picked over a 64GB card specifically because some devices don't work with cards over 32. It works in my MP3 players and another camera.,The picture quality is pretty bad. My Moto E4 is 13 megapixels vs. the Kodak's 16, and yet the pictures from the Motorola (itself not even being an especially impressive camera) are about twice as clear. In pictures from the Motorola phone, I can read text on a pill bottle half the size as the smallest readable text in pictures from the Kodak. It's nice to have a real 4x optical zoom, but at the 2x zoom level the Kodak only looks on par with a cropped photo from the phone. Functionally, this camera really only has a 2x zoom benefit over a wide shot from my phone. I'd rather just take a wide shot and crop out the exact part I want later. I also have a Samsung SL30 which wasn't a whole lot more than this several years ago, and it is also better. Unfortunately, I think the Point & Shoot camera industry is mostly dead.,Focusing speed is not bad for a cheap camera, but processing and saving the image is slower than I expected.,Some people are complaining about batteries dying quickly. Possibly this camera is less efficient than it should be, but alkaline batteries are generally not great for cameras because the zoom/focus and image processing actually use a lot of power even if only for a second or two. Alkaline batteries are terrible for fast draining, even only in short bursts like that. I like AA cameras because you can always grab some AAs in an emergency, but for regular use you should use disposable lithiums or rechargeable NiMH.,Overall, there seems to be very little reason to have this camera. I wanted an acceptable quality camera to use separate from my phone, but this isn't it.

product_name: GoPro HERO7 Black Camera + Extra Rechargeable Battery + PNY Elite-X 32GB U3 microSDHC Card (Bundle) - Waterproof Digital Action Camera Touch Screen 4K HD Video 12MP Photos Live Streaming Stabilization
review: This was my first experirnce with a gopro product.  I purchased the camera a few days before I went on vacation where I would be visiting family.  I purchased the GoPro Hero 7 black.,Originally I did not plan to use it in the water but I fell in love with this product so I ended up taking it everywhere with me, on land and in the water.,What I love about the camera is that is so small that I would hold it in my hands and take a video of my family in their natural state.  I was able to capture precious memories.

product_name: GoPro HERO7 Black Camera + Extra Rechargeable Battery + PNY Elite-X 32GB U3 microSDHC Card (Bundle) - Waterproof Digital Action Camera Touch Screen 4K HD Video 12MP Photos Live Streaming Stabilization
review: The operating manual does not include the set up instructions. The screen is very small and hard to see. Don't know if I want to go through the hassle of figuring out how to set it up. The online support is not responsive and mostly not available. So, don't expect to get one of these and be able to use it quickly or shortly after opening it up.
user: Frustrated Go Pro owner, wondering if I just wasted several hundred dollars.

product_name: GoPro HERO7 Black Camera + Extra Rechargeable Battery + PNY Elite-X 32GB U3 microSDHC Card (Bundle) - Waterproof Digital Action Camera Touch Screen 4K HD Video 12MP Photos Live Streaming Stabilization
review: Piece of crap keeps freezing, sometimes I have to turn it off by pulling off the case, and then the battery. Very unreliable, but decent picture, but files get corrupt and always need to repair itself. "It's a NoGo."

product_name: GoPro HERO7 Black Camera + Extra Rechargeable Battery + PNY Elite-X 32GB U3 microSDHC Card (Bundle) - Waterproof Digital Action Camera Touch Screen 4K HD Video 12MP Photos Live Streaming Stabilization
