product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G3 X G3X Digital Camera (HotPink)
review: Prompt shipping, came in good condition. I would buy again. Thank you!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: We purchased this light weight compact camera for traveling but it’s so good I’m using it instead of my DSLR (it’s so heavy). It doesn’t replace my Canon 70D, but I’m loving the convenience of having all the manual capabilities as my other camera. The touch screen rocks and it offers so many different setting options plus the biggest perk, the lens offers such a huge range, super strong zoom and an aperture as low as 2.8f, creative play time!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It is a really good camera for an beginner like me. I have gotten some really good pictures with it.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I also bought a "Shot Gun Microphone" with audio plug and that's when I noticed there is no audio receptor on the FZ80, so enhancing sound is not an option as far as I can see.,Does anyone else have an Audio plug on their Lumix FZ80? and if not, what is the workaround?,I gave it 3 stars, but still learning and will upgrade if I find the reason. (6-12-19 I upgraded to 4 stars) take great pics, the zoom is impressive when set right. So that could be the settings, there are many and I am still not sure of what combo is best.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I love this camera for everything.  Maybe for a serious pro use you need a Nikon D5.  Last Nikon I had was the D2.  Got too expensive.  I love the LUMIX lens and recently I shot a pic at about 22X right throwing the home Venetian blinds of an unusual formation in a distant tree.  Focused perfectly on the object of interest with no blind showing.  Great travel camera and easy to learn its intricacies.  Can’t beat the lens either. While the sensor provides over 16 mp its is a small sensor, under 29 mm^2, about the same as an iPhone which makes very low light imaging subject to dark noise in the sensor.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I’ve been an avid photographer for a couple years and was in the market for a high zoom point and shoot camera and this one definitely did not disappoint it claims it has 1200 mm of optical zoom which it definitely does but there’s a hack that you can get over 4000 mm of zoom with this camera amazing for the price and the picture quality  is great depending on the light and how far you are zoomed in with that being said I highly recommend this camera to any family anybody traveling or somebody that is looking into  photography

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera because I noticed that my iPhone was outperforming my Panasonic DMC-FZ100 by its' ability to stop a tennis ball in flight. The iPhone has a feature called HDR that permits better photos of rapidly moving objects. The DMC-FZ70 also has this ability. I tested it and it also stopped tennis balls in flight. I wanted this capability for sports pictures and because I have young grandchildren that seem to be in constant motion when I want a picture. I also wanted the telephoto ability for sports and wildlife photos. It would cost a small fortune to get the telephoto ability for a DSLR camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I'll have the time to figure out how this works. I have yet to take a good picture with this camera. I got this because a reviews Website recommended it for Macro photography - big mistake. Not only can I not figure out how to do that, it barely takes even decent snapshots. My cell phone is better. Wish I didn't buy this and can't say I'd recommend it. It does have many features, so I suppose if you are willing to take the time to read all about it and watch tutorial videos or what have you, then maybe this isn't bad - but if you're looking for something more intuitive, I'd look elsewhere.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: First, I'm a complete novice in serious photography.  This camera is meant to get my feet wet, get me familiar first hand with the 'issues'.  That said, my rating is great, 4 stars.  Some things could be more satisfying to me so not five stars.,Zoom, clarity, basic ease of use are very good, 5-star worthy.  The combined weight of the negative factors below is only enough, to me and for now, to cost the 5th star.,Grip point on the camera for hand shooting is small (ok, I've big hands), somewhat awkward in location versus camera mass and makes me feel I'll drop the camera.  The image stabilization is the best I've used - compared against phones and an old, cheap camera I have - but not quite what I'd hoped for.  Auto-focus is sometimes strangely flaky.  Battery life is 'meh', I'm buying a second battery to work around that.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Strap broke in 5 months. Not covered by warranty, though honestly they're probably doing you a favor, since you shouldn't trust it anyway. For most, I'd say buy yourself a $100 camera, or even just use your cell phone if you're not too concerned about a lot of zoom. If you're going digital, chances are good you won't need the $200 worth of bells and whistles I (over)paid for.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I was skeptical about a camera with one lens with such a large zoom range, but I couldn't be happier with it! This camera allows me to capture great close ups without the hassle of changing lenses, and the quality is quite good for prints. I am a "nikon person", but I am selling my Nikon D3300. The convenience and quality of the Lumix beats the Nikon hands down. Awesome awesome awesome!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This Sony takes good pictures but I just wish that for the price Sony would have used a better LCD screen. I mean my cheap no name camera had a better LCD display. I mean I understand it's more of an entry camera but this is Sony not some cheap brand. This camera was for my mother but I guess I was expecting it to be similar to my own Sony.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I've had Sony cameras before and this one is pretty easy to use (to me). This was purchased for a friend and I showed him the settings etc. The simple auto setting only went up to a 5mp image which is likely why some people were getting poor shots. Its not as simple as an emtry level camera could be, but it also does more than it would seem at first glance.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Very small camera, probably the smallest I have seen, which is great for those who don't like carrying a big camera with them. The picture quality was not the best when seen it on the camera, but the image looks better when seen on the computer.,I gifted it to my dad who loves small cameras and is not concerned too much about the resolution of the image. I will possibly buy a new one that shoots a better quality of pictures even if it is a bigger size. The 20.1 MP really does not add much to the picture quality as expected.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Ok, it's not gonna replace my "big" cameras, but this has become my "take it everywhere" camera. It is 3.7 inches long, 2 inches high and a bit more than a half inch thick. It weighs about as much as a pack of gum, yet it shoots 20mp, has an 8X optical zoom, a Zeiss Vario-Tessar lens and uses standard SDHC memory cards. In "P" mode you have full control over ISO, White Balance, Focus, Metering and more (though no manual mode). You never notice it in your pocket. $99 at Amazon. Amazing, and highly recommended! I can't get over the price...

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I am so sad about this camera. I've been brand loyal to Sony, since my first child was born, and we've used Sony Cybershot since 2006. When they broke in the past, it was my fault (dropping it etc), but this is my 4th time buying one, and the quality has taken a nosedive. It is not worth the name anymore, and now I don't trust the SONY name either.  This camera is flimsy, so the battery is hard to get in and out, but once it's in, it can easily fall out. But worse than the battery issue is the fact that it takes a long time to focus/take the shot, and then a really long time to take a repeated shot, even without the flash. You can't effectively take photos of children, which is mission critical for me.  The other Cybershots, even back in 2006 were not this slow!  How can it be this bad 8 or 9 years later?

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I got this one to replace an older model that I have had for years that I have dropped too many times on the concrete.  This newer model is great.  I had purchased a Canon Elf first and I hated it.  This is a great little camera that I carry on my motorcycle or kayak and it always delivers great pictures. I love it!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I initially bought a bigger camera with more features for my daughter, and then decided to give her the choice between that camera and this one.  She picked this one!  She prefers the smaller size, but she did try both out to compare photo quality.  This camera actually had truer colors than the other one did.  It was also easier for her to operate.  So, now I'm packing up the other camera and returning it.  This camera will serve my daughter well and the fact that it's so compact just can't be beat!  It's a great value and so easy to use!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I know this is not an expensive camera so I'm not dinging it for picture quality. It is good enough for the price point. What drives me insane is it's inability to stay in focus. Anytime I am taking video it randomly but often decides to go out of focus 10-20 seconds in and will not regain focus.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Great little camera for the price. Was not looking for a camera for professional use. just something the wife and I could use for vacations and family events. Small enough to fit in a shirt pocket . Simple to use and has many nice features usually found on more expensive units. If your looking for a small camera that takes great pictures, you could hardly go wrong with this.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The screen is super flimsy. It's literally junk. ALL images are blurry, focus is crap. I would return it, but somehow being inside of my pocket broke the screen. Screen still works, but its cracked and has a blacked out area now. Complete waste of money.

review: Decent camera, but Honestly I'm kind of disappointed in the quality of pictures.  You would think that more mega pixels would mean a better picture, but I think my 10 year old 8.1 mega pixel Casio camera seems like it takes better pictures than this...

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Bought March 20th broke by May 20th.,I like to keep a point and shoot in my back pocket while hiking etc. They last 2 - 3 years, not this one.,The photos are grainy and now photos are terrible either a bright white or black screen/photo.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera for when I go to events and on trips and it's a really nice camera! The picture quality is better than my phone's picture quality which in my opinion is a plus! Already have used it a few times and really happy with it! It's really compact too so I'm not worried about it taking up huge amount of space in a travel bag. Overall, a really affordable great option for a camera!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Very good pocket camera, easy to use and takes very high quality photos.  The perfect size to have with you all the time.  I own several Nikons with all the lenses and all that, but they are too big to haul around all the time, and the photos I get from my I-phone are of mediocre quality at best.  This is a really good solution.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: The display is a little small and distorts colors, the colors don't look very vivid on the screen but once you get them on the computer they look great. It takes a long time after it's taken the picture to show you the picture and get back to where you can take more, so you can't just click click click take a bunch of pics which stinks trying to photograph little kids.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I have 2 13 year old Sony Cyber-shots and I am extremely happy with them.  One was a gift to my daughter and one is my personal camera. The new one takes videos which what we will use for my grandchildren's sports and dance team videos. Having thirteen years of good photos with no problems is the best reason to buy a Sony product.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Simple enough interface and very easy connecting it to my computer.  I have problems adjusting the settings so my pictures are often darker than they should be but I'm still working on it.  I use this at work to take photos of lab samples and the images are crystal clear (tanks to the shaky hand correction thing built in) vs the previous 500 dollar camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Takes perfect, detailed pics of my jewelry. I didn't even have to use the zoom feature. Though the pics of the ear rings are from about 8 inches away, with standard 4 foot LED Bulbs in the 1 overhead light Fixture

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Cameras on phones are nice for the convenience, but no matter how good they may be, nothing can take the place of a good camera.  Since my last camera was stolen, I wanted to replace it and the quality of the Sony, along with a very good price, gives me better photos and even the ability for video.  Thank You!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: charged it once, which lasted a long time, now that I need to charge it for the second time it is not charging. When I went to return it, it is too late. do not waste your money on this. This product didn't even last me 8 months.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Great product! I like this camera a lot, it's cheap for what it does. It captures everything in seconds and my parents love how compact it is. It's a great gift for anyone young or old. I honestly think the qualities are as good as my phone. Thumb up!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Can I leave no Stars?? Really really bad. Bad build quality. Hard to use. Bad picture quality. Complete and total piece of junk.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: i needed a new camera after my phone broke. my phone had 16mp and since this camera had 21mp i thought it would be perfect, especially since the reviews said it was so good. it's not. the flash is awful..if you use it everything is blindingly white. but if you don't use it, everything is dark, discolored, and not anywhere as crisp as i hoped. i found out that you have to set it to 21mp in the settings or it's automatically on it's lowest, 5mp, but for 21mp it's a real disappointment. my old phone with an 8mp camera takes about the same quality pictures. i ended up giving it to my 4 year old.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this as a replacement for  Canon I'd bought my wife a few years ago that just quit working after hardly any use at all. I have an old Canon Powershot that has taken a beating and kept ticking, but the newer models don't seem to be as tough and aren't repairable at all. The firmware on this  camera is surprisingly decent. It has locked up on me once and simply removing the battery to reboot fixed that. The included spare battery is a very nice and useful surprise. Charging is fairly quick and when the camera is charged the red LED shuts off. Battery longevity is good to excellent. Setup is, luckily, pretty intuitive, because the manual is laughable and about as helpful as a plague-infected Deer Tick.,It's not obvious from either the camera or the manual, but there is a cool lens change switch feature  just above the USB port that allows you to shift the camera from distance focus to close and it works very well. The camera's software, however, far exceeds the camera's lens quality and that is the consistent limiting factor in picture quality. It would be unreasonable to expect a high quality lens in a $35 camera, so don't. However, because of the ease of use, battery life, well-designed features, size, and convenience, I find myself grabbing this camera instead of my Powershot 2 out of 3 times I decide to take a picture. If we lose it or break it, it won't be a big financial loss and I'd probably buy another.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This would be a great "first camera" for a young kid. Cheap enough they could break it within a year and you won't even be mad (and definitely cheaper than letting them use your phone camera), simple enough that they won't be overwhelmed, but still handling mostly like a typical digital camera so if/when they step-up to something a bit more feature-heavy they're going to feel comfortable and familiar. The landscape/zoom quality is horrid, but the macro mode on close-up objects did ok. The menu navigation is simple and fairly intuitive.,The 21 megapixel claims are meaningless - the sensor is tiiiiiny so there's not enough data to meaningfully fill in all those pixels. Picture quality is actually more like 10mp in most lighting conditions, and even in bright light I'd only say 12mp equivalent on landscape shots.,There's no control (like half-pressing the shutter button) that will show where the picture focus is. The view display is grainy enough that it's hard to tell just by looking, and there doesn't seem to be a way to zoom in in"view taken pictures" mode to check focus after the fact. So just, point, click, and hope for the best.,If you're an adult looking for a cheap pocket camera you're not going to cry about losing, I ended up getting the Coolpix A10 for about twice as much as this thing (and that's without ANY accessories), but the A10 has some optical zoom and a bigger sensor so average picture quality is better even though it has less nominal mp.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Ordered this as gift for my daughter. Tested it out before giving it to her and installed a formatted card. I was able to take 2 pictures and then I noticed the picture count go from 1000+ to 0. Went to review the pics and the camera showed no pics available. I tried a second formatted memory card and got the same results. Returned for full refund. I do not recommend this camera

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: We bought three of these for the kids to take out west on vacation. All three performed as expected, really no issues. Picture quality is just ok. Not extremely to use, Takes a couple minutes to figure out how to navigate. Sound quality is horrendous.  When you un-box it your going to think, Oh man, What did I do? Mainly because the camera itself feels like its going to disintegrate in your hand it's so cheap and lighter than you think a camera should ever be. But, If you are buying a first camera, A throw away camera or intentionally looking to buy a cheap camera. This is your guy. We knew when we purchased these the kids were not going to take care of them anyway. If they made it for the two week vacation, Hey, Thank the Lord. And they did, all three. I would never buy this camera as my main camera or maybe even as a backup if I had a choice. You really get what you pay for in this case. But, they worked, At this point one is currently lost, were down to one charging cable and lost 2 out of 6 batteries. Perfect purchase for us.......  Hope this helps.....

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I wanted a camera for everyday frequent use other than a smartphone.  I first ran into the problem when I couldn't take any pictures.  I thought that it needed a sd card so I put one in.  The problem was "card error" in red letters.  I then made the mistake of thinking there was something wrong with my sd card.  I ordered another sd card with the same effect "card error"  I did try to format many times with both sd cards with no success.  I passed my time limit to return this camera so I am now warning others in case they make the same mistake that I made.  This camera may not have cost much but if it doesn't work then my money went straight into the trash.  I can't even donate it to charity because I know it doesn't work.  Very disappointed.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I love taking pictures on trip, but my phone isn't usually high enough quality and I don't want to lug around my big DSLR and worry about it getting hurt. This camera is small and portable so I don't have to worry about it taking up a bunch of space. It doesn't come with a memory card, so be aware of that, but with the price difference between this and other small cameras, you can definitely afford to get a memory card. It comes with a wrist strap, carrying pouch, a charger, and two batteries. This is perfect for trips where you don't have enough space for a bigger camera!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Bought this for my 8 year old granddaughter and she loves it. She is still learning it isn't a toy, so she has to keep it away from her baby sister so it doesn't get broke. Doesn't want to put it down.

review: Just got camera, unpacking everything looks very confusing.  The owners manual is very small with very small print and icon pics are so small even young adults with good eyesight have trouble seeing them clearly. For me as an older adult with reading glasses it is hopeless.  Also they want you to upload photo's after downloading their wifi program so if you think you will be able to link to your computer think again. The process is confusing and frustrating. Be ready.  I don't know if it takes decent photos yet since I can't upload them. I would have traded all the silly addons for one upload cable.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have use the camera to take about 500 photos [at 16mp] and 20 videos [at 720P]. The quality of both photos and videos suprised me. Even at full 60X zoom [in sun], the photos were focused and the colors pretty accurate. Indoor photos with flash had to be white balanced but came out pretty good; though I liked the color balance better without flash. When I am watching these photos on my 27" monitor they are pretty good; however, if I digitally zoom in 2 or 3 steps, the photos pixilate, show noise [especially when camera automatically switched to iso 400 or greater] or indicate they were not focused over the entire photo [espec. if depth of field was over 10-20 meters]. Check out sample of Panama Canal on a rainy/cloudy day, and statue in Guatamala on a sunny day with plants.,But for a camera with a 1/2.3" sensor and such a great flexibility in lenses and shooting mode- I am very happy with the quality of photos and videos I got with this camera. I recommend it to anyone who wants a fairly cheap and light, very flexible super zoom camera; and doesn't need the photo quality of a DSLR or 4/3 camera,

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera simply because of the awesome zoom range... I believe it's the only super zoom camera with the 20 to 1200mm range. At $227 price here on Amazon, it's just one heck of a deal if you ask me. Is the photo quality as good as  $3000 to 5000 dollar large sensor camera's with 2 or 3 different expensive zoom lenses that you'd have to have to get this same zoom range? No, but it's a few thousand dollars less expensive too!,Now, with that being said, I am actually pretty pleased with the image quality out of this camera and even find the low light abilities to be pretty good as well. I don't need to use the flash even inside with low lighting and the pictures come out pretty good. This camera has numerous different settings, more than I'll ever use. But I find the automatic settings work great for almost everything I want to do. I'm not a professional and not a photography nut either.... but I'd say this camera gives me as good of pictures as any I have ever owned... and given that's even when using the massive 60X zoom, I am VERY pleased with this camera.,The video recording works pretty good on this camera too. Now don't be fooled by Panasonic saying it will do 60fps, this just isn't true and is a mis-leading thing Panasonic puts out there. If you look at the specs where they say it can do 60fps, you'll see an asterisk that says the sensor output is at 30fps.... you know what that means? It means this camera will only give you 30fps output, not 60fps. They arrive at 60fps by duplicating frames. So you really aren't recording at 60fps. This is not an issue for me with most of my video recording and the video out of this camera actually looks very nice. But if I am recording something with lots of high speed motion, I would use my Sony Camcorder or GoPro so I have the actual 60 or 120 fps recording speeds.,In conclusion without getting into techy stuff, for this price range, and having the massive 60X zoom, I'd say this camera performs exceedingly well! I find the auto modes just simply produce great pictures very consistently, it just works! It also has many manual settings you can use as well, so I think it's a great all around camera. I think this is the camera I will use most often.,I've attached some pictures to show the quality in varying lighting conditions. I've ordered them in sequence so you can see the zoom progression from near to far. All these pics were taken in intelligent Auto mode, except for a couple that I shot in HDR.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Wow what a camera!  I have had many, many cameras over the years from film to digital.  This is for me the best I have ever owned.  I love the way it takes pictures and all of the options available through its settings.  I bought this camera after doing lots of research and decided to pay a bit more so I could have both a wide angle and long lens in one camera.  I have a Canon with lots of lenses but truth be told I no longer want to be lugging around a heavy camera bag and tripod.  With the Lumix I can point and shoot or adjust speed and aperture to my hearts content.  My vacation has been greatly enhanced with this camera and the shots I have taken are vastly superior to anything I can take with my cell phone.  It has a number of creative settings which function like filters for close-ups, scenery or special effects.  It also does double duty as a 4k film camera for short takes.  I also like the Panorama setting that allows you to get a wide landscape shot to capture more of the surrounding environment.  One caution is to be very careful when ordering extra rechargeable batteries.  By mistake I bought a battery that fit perfectly but would not charge.  When I investigated further it turned out to be a battery for the FZ70.  So be extra careful and make sure the battery is for the FZ80.  Also, on that note the camera thus far has held up to a full day of photography.  I have had to recharge at the end of each day so having extra batteries on hand is a good idea.,This is a very nice piece of photographic equipment.  No complaints thus far and I can recommend it without hesitation.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Bought this for my wife.  This is a great camera suitable for either an entry level photographer or as an all around general purpose unit with features beyond the price point.,Some negative? reviews about features seem unfounded.  For a guy who grew up on Nikon and owned as many as 4 bodies at once this is highly recommended.  If they made a high end unit I could be swayed.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera is a great step up from a simple point and shoot, while keeping all the usefulness of a point and shoot.  The zoom is incredible, and of course requires steady hands to get the best shot possible.  That said, the image stabilizer helps and you can actually take reasonably clear shots zoomed in by hand.  I was at a ball game the other night, and from my seat, the entire park fit in the frame of a single picture.  Zooming in, without digital zoom (60x), the batter would fill more than the screen and I was able to see footprints in the dirt...,I also took the camera to the races, and after a handful of attempts was able to get a classic picture with a clear car and blurry background.  That takes a little more skill to accurately track the car so it remains clear.  Easy to use, and the battery life actually lasted much, MUCH, longer than I was expecting.  Leaving the camera on, allowing it to sleep when it wants, I would be able to take fairly nonstop pictures all day I did buy 2 extra (generic) batteries as I plan to take this on a two week trip to Peru, but I am confident that it will have enough life.  The camera does have some weight to it but is easy to use.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Brings me closer to the birds, than my 24x zoom, and wasn't too expensive.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: For years, I've debated what camera to take birding. The choice is between being a BIRDER, that is, using binoculars to look at birds, and being a BIRD PHOTOGRAPHER, more interested in the great photo than spotting everything. Fortunately, I have had the good luck to travel with photographers, leaving me free to spend time looking. I've considered getting the gear necessary to take good photos, but the investment, both in dollars and weight, is significant.,Finally, a camera comes along made for people like me. It is small and light enough to carry around all day, yet capable of taking great photos. The lens extends to provide 60x optical zooming, coupled with superior image stabilizing firmware that I find myself snapping away. If the birds are distant, well, you at least have a record shot. However, when you have one reasonably close, you may get a real keeper.,I love this camera and it will be part of my birding equipment from now on.,The only minor complaint I have is that it doesn't seem to have an option to recharge the battery using the USB cable, meaning that you have to pack yet another battery charger on a long trip.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It is a very good camera for the price BUT I would not buy it again for some reasons:,1. The quality of the lens is not very good, there is a lot of chromatic aberration whenever you use the optical zoom.,2. As happened with another Lumix I had (FZ30), there is a lot of noise whenever you use an ISO higher than 100. I compared images taken with this camera and a Canon Powershot A710is (under the same circumstances and similar settings) and when you amplify the image in your monitor at the point that you can see the pixels, there is a lot more noise on the images taken with the Lumix.,Other than that, the video is very nice, and the optical zoom is simply unbelievable.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera is AMAZING!!! I cannot say enough about it, honestly. Let's start with the camera quality itself. It looks and feels incredibly expensive... hard to believe a camera this nice is so affordable. It has a nice weight and is sturdy in your hands. The design makes it easy and comfortable to hold. It has a viewfinder as well as a digital display, making it versatile. Next, its functionality. The zoom capability is UNBELIEVABLE. I could zoom in to see freckles on my dad's face from across a parking lot, and I am not exaggerating. The picture quality is professional-level. I have yet to try the HD video feature but I look forward to it- I have no doubt it will be as exceptional as the rest of the features. Finally, the cost. This camera was not that much more expensive than most small point and shoot cameras, but the quality of both the camera itself and the pictures it takes is exponentially higher than its less expensive counterparts. I am truly shocked that an amateur like myself can afford to own such an excellent camera, and furthermore be capable of operating such a camera without any expertise. I highly recommend this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Everything about this product and the seller is awesome!  Item arrived quick, safe and sound.  From the moment I grabbed the camera I could feel the quality and it does take awesome pictures.  Focus is clear, exposure in automatic mode is spot on and the range of the lens makes it the perfect one camera does it all solution.  I am going to sell my multi lens DSLR because this is a lot more convenient and with equal or better results.  Extreme zoom situations best use tripod.  You will not be disappointed!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The shutter speed on this camera is sooooo slow. Turning it on & getting it to focus are painfully slow.  Hope you don't want to take another picture right away, because you are likely to miss your chance due to the extended wait time between taking a picture and the camera being ready to take the next photo. Photo quality is ok. The slowness of the camera is just extremely frustrating.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I liked that the camera was so easy to use and also so portable. It easily fit in my pocket. The videos and photos were pretty good, but I got the camera too close before my trip, so I didn't know how to zoom yet! That would have felt better. But that's me not the camera! It definitely takes better pics than my phone!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I purchased this a few months ago when I was going on a vacation to replace my Canon Sure Shot. I wanted something that was smaller and with higher resolution and zoom. I chose this camera because my first digital camera was a Sony and it took great photos (much better than the Canon I had replaced it with). Well... out of the three digital cameras I have owned this one definitely takes the lowest quality pictures. The pictures seem slightly out of focus, and the colors are bland and not at all vibrant. My iPhone takes much better pictures than this camera!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I bought this for a trip to Scotland. I was very disappointed with the quality of this camera. Landscape photos turned out blurry along the perimeter of the photo and semi clear towards the middle. We eventually gave up on this camera and just started using our phone to take pictures since the phone quality was better. The build quality of this camera also felt very cheap.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This little camera makes it convenient to take pictures but has limitations on flash and focus.  In general it does what it was meant to do and should not be expected to take professional or near professional quality photos.  Action photos are not to be expected either as everything ends up a blur..

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: It was disappointing that there was no manual with this, and while it can be downloaded (for a fee) it involves several hundred pages.  Not what I will be doing any time soon.  I went to Best Buy and a nice young man spelled it all out for me, taking time to show me exactly how to use all the features even though it was not purchased there.  I did buy the memory stick and a case from him because he was so helpful.  This is an upgrade of a camera I had for several years and I expect the same good results from this one.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I bought this Camera to replace an early version, over 8 years old.  Twice the features plus more than double the megapixels and half the price of my older pocket Camera.  Easy to use, easy to stick in your pocket, and GREAT pictures.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: We have this camera where I volunteer and I just loved it and wanted one for myself.  I have been super happy with it.  Takes great pictures and is very compact and easy to carry in my purse.  I just have to remember to leave it at home when I volunteer so we don't get them mixed up.  I highly recommend it!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Great little camera. Super easy to take anywhere. Fits inside a jacket pocket. I put a 128g memory card in mine, reads it fine. The only down side I've seen (not to bad) is the time it takes for the picture to take after you hit the button. I have a baby, and I get a lot of missed faces because of the delay.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Love this camera. Used it all day 4th of July and then took it on a 10-day vacation and, after charging it initially, I only had to charge it one time. Got the SanDisk 32GB card to go with it & took at least 200 photos and all turned out perfectly.  Very easy to use - can snap pictures with one hand and they are easy to download to my computer.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I bought this for a young relative. It takes good pictures.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: So far enjoy using -- like the use of 2A batteries

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: The size for small hands.  Personal

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: You get a lot for the money.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10

Use it for real estate due to wide angle and using double A batteries.  Ordered an older Coolpix L32 and will use this one only for a back up.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: It's okay.  I don't like it near as much as my old CoolPix, but it will do.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I really like it.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Good Quality

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Camera and lenses come in their own velvet pouch and two lense covers to prevent screen from scratching. It has a timer and focus easily.It has auto flash capabilities but when I took pictures of my puppy the red was taken out of his eyes. Camera was so easy to use my nephew took a few pictures. Play back mode for video  has great picture quality and color is very vibrant. I will definitely be taking this with me wearever i go.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Camera has issues with low light situations. Colors sometimes are off because of it. It's a nice size and has some decent features - but I wouldn't buy one again.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this for a vacation thinking a dedicated point and shoot might provide better photographs than my cell phone. Quickly learned thats not the case and point and shoot cameras like this have become obsolete. The only benefit this really gives is a true optical zoom but with fairly poor auto focus its a moot point. Pass on this, either stick with your smartphone or pony up and get a compact SLR camera

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I know it got great reviews, but I hated it.  The camera felt cheap.  The photos I took looked like photos I would have taken with a point and shoot camera 10 years ago, complete with the flash bulb that washes out faces.  I guess I was expecting more from a digital camera in 2015.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this as a Christmas gift to be used on a trip right after Christmas. Reviews looked decent. Half the videos and half the pictures are very blurry. It continues to refocus. I would not buy it again!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Perfect for my 9 year old! I didn't want to spend a fortune on a camera for him in case he loses it, and this had such great reviews so I thought I'd give it a try. It takes very clear pictures and it's light weight. I hope he doesn't end up losing it! Great camera, especially for the price!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera to use for an outdoor exploration group with kids. Upon opening it we had problems with the picture focusing and kept getting a message to turn on/off the power. Could never get the camera to work properly.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I love this little camera. I live where there is a lot of moisture in the air and my first camera, of the same type, stopped working within three months. Even so I replaced it with the same model because this camera takes such nice photos so effortlessly. I especially like the panorama setting. I recommend this camera for anyone wanting to take quick, high quality photos.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: There is no way this camera has a 20mp lens. My iphone 7 plus has Way better quality pics and stabilization. Do your self a favor and go with a nikkon.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: The only reason this is getting 4 stars and not 5 is I think the zoom could be a little better. I had the zoom maxed at my son's graduation and a few pics blurred, and I wish it zoomed a bit closer. Other than that, I am super impressed with the quality of pics 9 out of 10 times! For the price, I was willing to compromise with the zoom only being 5X. Overall this is an awesome little camera!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Takes great pictures (pixel rate is comparable to some of the better iphones).  Comfortable to carry and holds a charge all day.  Great purchase.
