product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: DISCLAIMER: (Yup, gonna be on every review I do from now on),This review is based solely on my facts and findings during the use of the Camera. I am, IN NO WAY, associated with Canon, the Seller or their partners/affiliates and I am NOT required to do this review. I may relate my opinions during this review, but they are simply that... my own opinions and are not meant to coerce anyone into buying this product. I hate having to do this, but I do a lot of reviews and want everyone to know that my reviews are Honest, Unbiased, and Factual (you can thank Amazon for this Disclaimer being on every review that I do now).,Why only four (4) stars? The LCD isn't as crisp looking as the actual Pictures and Videos really are and the Function/MENU settings are a bit cumbersome to learn (i.e. When/where they can be used as well as learning what options are available when using them).,GETTING STARTED:,Before buying this camera I would suggest that you download the User Manual to familiarize yourself with the Features and Functions of this camera. Also, this camera doesn't come with a SD card, nor does it have internal memory to store your pictures and videos, so you will need to purchase one before you are able to use this camera.,The first thing you will need to do is charge the battery using the included charger. Make sure to line up the Triangles when inserting the battery into the charger base and then plug it in to a power source (depending on which charger you have, USB or wall, will dictate your power source).,While the battery is charging, take a moment and insert your SD Card. Make sure to insert it correctly so as not to damage your memory card or camera - the metal contacts should face the front of the camera as you insert it.,I will not be going through every Feature and Function of the camera as it would be too in-depth to do so. However, you should be familiar with the Function Button on the back of the camera (It's the round dial on the back of the camera about in the middle on the right side). Here is a quick overview:,* Green AUTO Button - Changes between AUTO and Programming (P) modes and is the UP Button,* Gray INFO Button - Turns on and off the Information displayed on the LCD screen and is the DOWN Button,* Lightning Bolt Icon Button - Changes the Flash modes and is the RIGHT Button,* Person Icon Button - Turns on the Auto Focus Feature and is the LEFT Button,* Func. Set (Center) Button - Accesses the Function Menu and is the SET (OK) Button,NOTE: The Power Button is the Small Round Button on the Top of the Camera, The Shutter Button is the Large Round Button on Top of the Camera, The Zoom Lever is the Lever around the Shutter Button, The Playback Button is Button with the Green Play Icon just to the upper right of the LCD screen on the back of the Camera, The Record Button is the Button with the Red Dot just to the right of the Playback Button, The Delete Button is the Button with the Trash Can Icon just to the lower right of the LCD screen on the back of the Camera, and finally... The MENU Button (Self explanatory) is just to the right of the Delete Button. Watch the Video for the location of these Buttons.,After the battery is completely charged (the Amber Light will turn Green), insert the battery into the camera by aligning the Triangle Icon on the battery with the Battery Holder Tab then pull the Tab back towards the front of the camera and insert the battery until it locks into place.,Now that your camera is ready to use, let's get started learning how to use it.,If this is the first time you are powering on your camera you will notice that there is an option to set the Date, Time and Daylight Savings Time. You do not have to do this for the camera to operate correctly. It is used to store EXIF data pertaining to your pictures and videos that you take as well as Date Stamp them. If you do not know what EXIF data is, please look it up so that you may understand the security issues that could be of concern to you.,SETTING THE DATE:,You will need to use the Function Dial to set, or change, the Date and Time. Use the Up/Down Buttons to specify the current Date then use the Right/Left Buttons to move to the next option. Again, use the Up/Down Buttons to set the current time. If you are satisfied with how everything looks, you can press the Func. Set Button to advance to the next option or you can change the way the Date is displayed and select Daylight Savings Time. When you are satisfied with your settings, press the Func. Set Button to proceed to the next option.,On the next menu you will be able to change, or select, you current Time Zone. Use the Right/Left Buttons to select your Time Zone and press Func. Set to complete the process.,You can skip the above settings, but every time you power on your camera you will have to press Func. Set to skip the process. Note: You can change/set the above options at any time by pressing the MENU Button. Here's how:,* Press the MENU button,* Move the Zoom Lever or the Right/Left Buttons to highlight the Tools Icon,* Use the Up/Down Buttons to move through the settings until you highlight the Date/Time... option,* Press the Func. Set Button and then use the Up/Down & Right/Left Buttons to adjust your new settings.,* Press the Func. Set Button to complete the process,SETTING YOUR LANGUAGE:,If you are still in the Tools Menu, simply move to the Language option in the menu - it is the next to last option listed - otherwise proceed as follows:,* Press the MENU Button and move to the Tools Icon,* Use the Up/Down Buttons to move to the Language option in the menu and press Func. Set,* Use the Up/Down & Right/Left Buttons to navigate to your desired Language and press Func. Set,* Press the MENU Button to exit the menu - NOTE: Use the MENU Button any time you wish to exit ANY menu you are in.,TAKING YOUR FIRST PICTURE:,* Power on the Camera (As you power on the Camera look at the upper right hand side of the LCD display and note if "P" or "AUTO" is displayed - If AUTO is displayed then skip the next step),* Press the Green AUTO Button to select AUTO Mode (The AUTO Mode simply tries to set the Camera to the best options respective to your immediate environment),* Use the Zoom Lever to adjust your desired Zoom level,* Press & Hold the Shutter Button 1/2 way down to allow the Camera to automatically Focus and adjust the appropriate settings for your picture,* Press the Shutter Button fully to take your picture,NOTE: Please observe the LCD screen when holding the Shutter Button 1/2 way down for warning information regarding settings that may need some attention. Also, while in AUTO Mode your setting options will be limited. In Programming (P) Mode, you will have full control of all your Camera setting options that it is capable of using. Again, I will not be going through these two (2) modes as they are very in-depth.,TO VIEW YOUR PICTURE(S):,* Press the Green Play Button to enter Playback Mode,* Use the Right/Left Buttons to Scroll through your pictures for viewing - NOTE: You can press the Func. Set Button for more options during picture viewing.,RECORDING YOUR FIRST VIDEO:,* Select AUTO or Programming (P) Mode, as previously mentioned, then press the Func. Set or MENU Buttons to set any options for recording your video,* Press the Red Record Button (See above if you've forgotten where it is),* Use the Zoom Lever for Wide/Telephoto zoom level,* Press the Red Record Button again to stop recording - NOTE: During recording, the Lens movement (noise) while zooming In/Out will be recorded. Preset your zoom level to prevent this if it is an issue with you.,PLAYBACK YOUR VIDEOS:,* Press the Green Play Button,* Use the Right/Left Buttons to find the Video you wish to view,* Press the Func. Set Button (Play Movie will be displayed in the Function Menu),* Press the Func. Set Button again to play the Video,* Use the Up/Down Buttons to control the volume during playback,NOTE: To exit Playback Mode for both Pictures and Videos, press the Shutter Button to exit out to the Camera LCD screen (Ready Mode).,DELETING PICTURES AND VIDEOS:,* Press the Green Play Button to enter Playback Mode,* Use the Right/Left Buttons to find the Picture/Video you wish to delete,* Press the Trash Can Button,* Use the Right Button to highlight ERASE,* Press Func. Set Button and follow the prompts,NOTE: To erase multiple Pictures/Videos do the following:,* Press the Green Play Button to enter Playback Mode,* Press the MENU Button,* Use the Down Button to highlight ERASE...,* Press the Func. Set Button,* Use the Down Button to highlight one of the following options:, - SELECT - Allows you to pick the Picture(s)/Video(s) you want to erase (Use the Func. Set Button to select them then press the MENU Button and follow the prompts) NOTE: Use the Right/Left Buttons to move through the Images., - SELECT RANGE - Allows you to select a range of Pictures/Videos to erase, - ERASE ALL - This will erase EVERYTHING on your SD Card that is unprotected (This is the same for the above two (2) options),WARNING: Please pay attention and follow the prompts to avoid deleting files that are unprotected - you can not get them back. If you want to protect your Pictures/Video, please do the following:,* Enter Playback Mode by pressing the Green Play Button,* Press the MENU Button,* Use the Down Button to highlight Protect...,* Press the Func. Set Button and follow the prompts,OK folks... That's the Canon PowerShot ELPH in an nutshell. I've uploaded a short video showing the location of the above mentioned Buttons.,[...]

Camera just won't focus. It is also near impossible to take picture of a picture because it won't focus.,2. Cannot take panoramic photos,3. Cannot turn-off eye redness check which results in 'too much light' on close objects.,4. Flash can be either turned off or made to go automatic. But it cannot be set to always ON. So you cannot take clear picture inside of a house if your camera does not think that it is dark enough to require flash.

review: I bought this for my husband who is getting back into photography after about 20 years. We usually use our iPhones when we travel for photos but the quality is never as good as Apple advertises unless you want to spend hours photoshopping you pictures. Yes this is an older model but if has great flexibility as it takes high quality photos and will record video in full 1080p HD.,There are plenty of presets to point and shoot a variety of photos as well as full manual control for the more advanced photographers.,There is a long list of accessories that come in this package and I won’t go into them. The two smaller lenses are Canon the telephoto lenses is an off brand but appears to be well made.,If you are looking for a starter setup I highly recommend this package. One recommendation I do make is to buy a camera backpack as the bag that comes with this package does not hold everything.

Wow!!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had a Canon TSi for 5 years and recently my large zoom lens stopped working. So instead of buying a really expensive zoom lens I thought I would try one of the super zoom point and shoot cameras. Besides the normal family pictures I take lots of pictures of my kids playing basketball, football and soccer. I tried the camera for basketball and soccer and maybe got 5% useable pictures, the rest were blurry. I kept going back and reading directions and trying different settings. And yes I used a tripod as well (which did help and got the rate up to 15%). But even half of my "portrait" pictures were out of focus and blurry. I'm going to return this and check out the amazon reviews to try a different camera, any recommendations for good cameras for taking sport shots??

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: I bought this camera to replacing my aging Sony point and shoot cameras I use on my YouTube channel. I received the camera and its neat packaging. Its exactly the same look wise as well as feature wise as my old camera. But the new camera is far worse quality wise. The Sony W800 cannot take a good picture even with the stabilization feature. It blurs on the slightest movement and everything is quite grainy. The same is even worse for my videos. The camera is always out of focus at the most inopportune times and is grainy in the background on top of that. My old Sony was handier, shot perfect pictures, and guzzled down quality videos while being shot at, rained on, and sunned out. Not buying with Sony again. Its like they are purposely making their formerly reliable platform so bad as to make us upgrade to DSL.

review: Let's start with I like the color and the size.  It fits great into my pocket for bike rides and other outings when I don't want to use my phone and risk dropping my phone or draining the battery.  The picture quality is pretty good, I thought it would be better considering it is 20 MP.  I haven't had the camera long but can't seem to find settings to adjust lighting and outdoor back light. Also, the camera is so small, which is great for carrying around, I find that when I push the button I move/push the camera down causing a slight movement in the camera.  It almost feels like a toy.  So, there is a plus and negative to its size. Overall it meets my needs of a small portable camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Takes great pictures, Easy to use, and good zoom capabilities.  Cheapest price for a camera this style with this many megapixels.  Bought it for my youngest son (14) for a starter camera.  He is very happy with it.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I'm impressed with this camera's ability to take decent videos in less-than-perfect lighting conditions! My old Kodak shot videos that sometimes turned out almost completely black on the computer, even when I could see just fine in real life while recording. This camera takes videos that look just as bright on the screen as the room does in real life. I was told I couldn't get such a camera for a low price, so that was a nice surprise. They're a little grainy when you transfer them, and quiet for some reason so I have to speak more loudly then usual in them, but still better quality than my old camera's videos were. I'm very pleased with that.,The menu is easy to navigate and I was able to get the hang of it and figure everything out quickly without even referring to the manual - which, by the way, contains information about battery life and how long it takes to charge; another nice surprise. I also like having a panorama mode.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Takes good pictures, but the sensor is so small, it pales in comparison to a proper DSLR, so even though this camera is 20.1 megapixels, don't expect to get really good detail.  Still, not a bad camera for the price.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: it is very poor and basic camera. it takes 5 seconds to take photos from the moment you press the shutter. its lagging time is too slow. additionally, the flash does not work when you select advanced flashing. it only flashes when it thinks it is dark even though there are some photos you may want with more flashi lighting. so those without the lighting look so terrible. the video quality is also poor. this camera is for kids who do not want anything fancy.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: My grandson uses this camera to document his extensive collection of Leggo constructs and other collectables. Purchase through Amazon was fast and easy.  The camera works very well and was a well received gift.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: I have no idea how such a lousy camera has such rave reviews. I bought this as a Christmas present for my mother and she was so excited when she opened it up. By Christmas dinner, she was taking pictures of everything and everyone. I soon realized she was taking pictures 6 or 7 times over each time because there is a HUGE delay between the time the button is pressed and the photo is taken. Every single photo, someone was either blinking or just looked exhausted from smiling for too long. My mom said she could make due with the delay.,Upon closer examination of the pictures she took, I noticed everyone's skin came out looking nearly snow white, which I can't begin to understand because my entire family is of a mixed African descent.,After barely making it through christmas, we took the camera to a New Years Eve wedding ceremony, where my mother was introduced as her godson's mother because his mother doesn't live in Anerica. She asked me to take pictures of them walking down the isle together. I kid you not, we did not get ONE useable photo out of 101 shots. I used automatic, night mode, and party mode, and every single shot came out dark. I couldn't even distinguish my mother from my cousin, even though my mom was wearing a bright purple dress.,Finally, the charger for this camera is approximately one foot in length AT MOST. To give you some perspective on that, a typical iPhone charger is about three feet long. In other words, you have to leave the camera on the floor while charging or on a chair because a one foot cord is incapable of reaching a table of average height.,Overall, I'm actually extremely embarrassed that I purchased this camera for my mom. I offered to return this one and buy her a new one, but she said i shouldn't because "I can't afford it." Essentially, this is a nice way of saying that I clearly bought this camera on an extremely tight budget. I sincerely regret this purchase aside from my moms initial excitement from receiving it.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: This was a good camera at first. After 2.5 months, it stopped working.,I'm returning it.....

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: camera takes great pictures up close and pretty good at full zoom.  there is noise in the photos done at zoom but that is too be expected at this price. the battery last a long time.  I have gotten  over 2000 photos per charge with no flash.  Great video at full zoom however. I do a lot of nature shots and the videos come out the best I have seen in these conditions.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: We shoot wildlife shots and love the stabilization and zoom. Did not expect the digital function from 60 to 120x to be usable but provides very good results.  I did not intend to use the digital zoom but did so by accident and was amazed at the quality when compared to the optical at 60x. Worth every penny and easy to use for the novice

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great camera for the money. This camera takes wonderful pictures. I would first read the manual unless you are very familiar with these types of cameras. This one even came with a DVD as well as a book for the instructions of operating this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I'm totally impressed with this Lumix. I'm not an uber-photographer but I know my way around point/shoot cameras. I did my research before I bought my first long zoom camera.  I have had Nikon, Canon, Fuji. All are well made and do what you would expect. But this Lumix FZ70 is over the top good. I have not even tried all the features yet. Basically I set it to auto everything and I'm just loving the images I'm getting. Will be taking it on our Europe trip later on this summer. Just a quick example: Last week during the full "blood moon" we had a great view of it here in California. I put the camera on a tripod, set the zoom to 100x and waited. When it went into full eclipse I touched the shutter button. Because of the low light it automatically took a series of 7 or 8 shots. I could hear it during the process. The aggregated image was spectacular. The blood moon effect was awesome. I put it up on FB and received many kudos for the shot. I'm very pleased with my purchase. Way to go Panasonic. Did I mention the lens? Killer resolution on both wide and telephoto modes.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I love this camera, i took it with me on my european trip and it worked great.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is such an easy and fun camera to use.  I'm not a professional.  I have had several Canon's - the last being a Rebel Digital. This camera far exceeds the Rebel's ability.  The first day out with this camera I was able to capture a bald eagle in a tree with the excellent zoom (that the Canon would have never picked up).  I love the features, the ease of use and the video ability.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I'm not sure why this camera is getting such glowing reviews. As a point-and-shoot for daytime vacation photos, this camera is perfectly serviceable. At nighttime, or under any kind of "challenging" conditions (such as a concert), the camera is SLOW as molasses to take pictures, and the pictures are often washed out or out of focus. On vacation in Europe I took (no joke) 50+ pictures of the Grand Place in Brussels at night, and NOT ONE came out decently - all were extremely grainy or horribly out of focus, or both. However, pictures I took with my cell phone came out fine (given that it was a 5MP camera on a $79 phone). Also, pictures I took with my GF's *cheaper* Canon P&S looked fine. So it's not entirely me. I also took this camera with me to a recent CHVRCHES concert: despite being less than 30 feet from the stage, the pics I took with this camera are AWFUL - the pics taken with the 8MP camera on my (new) phone look a hundred times better. It's almost as if the firmware is somehow "off" on this camera or something. All I know is, this is my fourth digital P&S camera, and this is the worst one BY FAR - even the godawful HP digital camera I owned back in 2002 took better low-light pictures than this camera. Also, the battery latch has a nasty habit of popping open in my pocket, something that's never once happened with the HP and Canon cameras I've owned in the past.

review: We've owned several Sony point and shoots over the years.  This one was a big disappointment.  We figured that the price was so low due to the improvement in phone cameras.  But this was cheap because it is built rather cheap.  The photo quality was average to poor, and it just feels like a $100 camera that it is.,We don't use it anymore, and either use our phones, or take our Nikon DLSR with us.  This particular Sony is sitting the bench.,I don't recommend unless you are looking for a cheap extra camera and photo quality is not that important to you.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Bought this to replace my Sony Cyber-shot HX300 (50x optical zoom) as I was unhappy it malfunctioned less than 18mo. from purchase. Pros: better light for cloudy days, crisp pics of stationary close-up objects, 60x Zoom and price.,Cons: takes too long for auto-focus, pics are grainy and motor noise is annoying.,I did not need to use a ti-pod w/the Sony, but feel it may be necessary with this Panasonic for better results.,I might add, I am strictly an amateur, that enjoys photography as a hobby.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I needed a camera with a 60x zoom that was reasonably priced.  The picture quality is excellent.  The 1080p HD video gives the impression that you are there, enjoying the adventure.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: after reading the review,  as was said only 2 things missing on this camera, wi-fi & moveable display.  if U want that spend more money. otherwise this is one nice camera,  shooting at night from  a moving car thru the glass  really outstanding, settings more than enough, adjustable .  would recommend to anyone wanting a point and shoot camera.  20mm to 1200mm.  will cover most of a general nature, and then some.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera has been amazing so far.  Only had it for a few days, but am impressed as is my wife who has a Canon 6D with a couple $1000 lenses.  Bought this so we could just take some decent easy everyday shots without lugging around my wife's camera.  What I've observed so far is that the flash is great!  It actually makes pics look better rather than washed out and over exposed.  The zoom is AMAZING.  I get amazing detail and pictures from a hundred yards away.  Took it to the San Diego Zoo and got best pictures ever of multiple animals like I was 5 ft from them.  It also focuses great!  The pics are sharp and crisp.  So far the camera has been pretty intuitive, but I'm going to have to break out the manual for the burst mode.  Can't find it.  Also, not sure how the aperture priority vs the shutter priority works.  Wife tried to explain, but this will take some reading on my part.  I'm below an amateur.  The only real things I have to compare to are two different Nikon point and shoots I tried previously.  The Nikons provided a blurry picture and the zoom didn't focus making it unusable.  If you're looking for near DSLR quality at a good price, size, and weight I definitely recommend this camera.  I'm contemplating buying another one for my wife who really likes it as well.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This camera has a very poor image quality.  Even at ISO 100 and 1/125,  the image has terrible noise giving the appearance that the image is out of focus. Chromatic aberrations are present at every setting. Nothing is sharp, regardless of conditions and regardless of ISO, SS, aperture.  Low light setting defaults to 1/30,  but,  the flash does not produce a hot enough light to focus the subject.  Terrible camera.  I am a professional who wanted a little pocket camera to take photos of friends at an event. I had low expectations and this camera did not even meet the lowest possible standard.  My point and shoot that is five years old does a better job than this camera.  I should have just used it.  I am REALLY disappointed.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It is a good upgrade from the basic point and shoot camera or cell phone camera.  Definately not the same quality as a DSLR, but that is expected.  A good travel camera.  To get the most out of the camera, you really want to start learning how to use the manual settings.  One note for low light/night time shots, the manual settings only allow a maximum of an 8 second exposure.  Auto allows for longer exposures.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The reason I gave this 4 stars is that this is a great little camera for those who want to move into the more advanced photography than allowed by the simple point and shoot ones.  It takes wonderfully sharp pictures and has an easy override for the exposure.  It has quite a number of photographical effects that would take large camera bag filled with filers and gadgets to accomplish in a film camera.  The viewfinder is a lot more comfortable in taking pictures than the screen at the back of the camera which is prone the washing out in bright light.  One feature I especially like is the ability to set the view finder so that it is overlaid with a horizontal and vertical lined grid.  This not only helps with composition but also for aligning vertical structures for architectural photography and also keeping the horizon level.  I have nearly the same view screen in two of my three film SLR’s,A minor complaint I have is that the camera lens reverts most wide angle zoom mode when first turned on.  I would prefer it to start with a more normal view of around 3x to 4x zoom.  It has a lens resume option, but that takes it back to the zoom position last used when the camera was turned on.,A not so minor problem is that it takes nearly three hands to plug the mini USB adapter into the camera.  One to hold the black camera, one to hold open the little black access door, and one to insert the little black mini adapter into the black opening of the black camera.  Night vision glasses and a third hand could be very useful.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera thinking it would be better than the same camera but model FZ60. I loved my FZ60!! the bad thing was it just quit working after 2 years and I have no idea how to get it repaired. This newer model with the extra zoom is very hard to use unless you have a tripod. It does not take shots well with motion and the zoom is very difficult to use for amateurs like myself. I did not see the FZ60 on here for sale anymore but I would buy it again. I am just trying to sell this model to someone in my family and I will purchase something else. I did read the reviews and most people liked it. I also think it does not focus well and takes a long time to make clear when zooming.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

I had a Canon SX50 HS before this, even though the pics were good and I hated the handling of it, sold it and bought this one. This one is tops in my books.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Camera works great. A lot of different options to try out. The 60x zoom is fantastic. I just used it the the first time last week in CO. I saw something on my walk about 500 yards away. Couldnt make it out with the naked eye so i zoomed in on it and it was a coyote clear as day. I do recommend a tripod for long range snaps. Hard to hold steady. Overall its a great product

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Owned for a few weeks now. Used almost exclusively for nature photography, ranging from close ups of insects to distance shots of birds.,The FZ70 does many things well: it has a great zoom, the buttons for control of the features are easy to reach, even when your eye is pressed to the viewfinder (after a bit of practice), and has enough stabilization to allow sharp, handheld photos at full optical magnification. The manual focus control isn't nearly as good or as quick as a ring, but will get the job done if your subject will stay still. It's not a macro camera by any means, but I've been happy with butterfly photos taken far enough away to not startle the insect.,That being said, comparing to my partner's Canon SX50, a few limitations have made themselves clear. The first, and most obvious, is the difference in digital zoom. Pushing the magnification beyond the optical limitations, the FZ70's quality deteriorates much, much more rapidly than the Canon. For distant shots of eagles, the Canon still looks crisp while the FZ70 becomes fuzzy. This holds for both for automatic and for various manual settings. The screen and viewfinder also aren't quite up to par, which makes determining perfect focus or reviewing photos a bit more of a challenge.,At the time of this review, the FZ70 is also $100 cheaper than the Canon SX50, which certainly played into my purchasing decision. It is a very good camera, but I wouldn't say it's the best in its class.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This thing is horrible!! Do not waste your money like I did on it. I only use Canon cameras, I owned the previous elph that lasted from 2011 until last year when my 2 year old accidentally got sand in it on vacation. Hence the purchase of this one as a replacement. I also own the Canon 7D, so I'm pretty sure if I can use manual mode on that but can't get this point and shoot to work, it's definitely a horrible product. Other sites have horrible user ratings but somehow I went by the ones on this that give it 4/5. It doesn't focus for anything and we found this out when I was in the hospital having our 2nd child and didn't want to use cell phones. I'm the only one who knows how to use my professional camera and I was having a baby, so I wanted something my husband and family could pass around. So very disappointed. Do not buy this product!!! Horrible horrible quality photos, even if it looks like its focused in. What a waste of money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Warning! No image stabilization! This is my 5th or 6th Canon powershot camera and they all used to have image stabilization, even the entry level cameras. I don't know at what point they took this away from entry level cameras, but this really affects picture quality. Luckily, I was able to get my ancient SD 1200 working again, which takes much better pictures even though it is MUCH older. If you are interested in this, I strongly suggest spending the extra $20 and going up a level, as that one seems to have image stabilization. IS really makes a difference in any indoor or darker environment. I wish I would have paid attention to this detail, but you never previously needed to. Be aware. I'm also bugged that this camera has fewer manual controls than older models of entry level cameras. Is it time to switch brands or start using my phone more?

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX530 HS Digital Camera with 50x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3-Inch LCD HD 1080p Video (Black)+ Extra Battery + 24GB Class 10 Card Complete Deluxe Accessory Bundle And Much More
review: I hate this camera.  I've had two Canon's before this one and each one has cost more and taken poorer pictures.  I don't believe it's my photography skills, it's just a poor camera. If I ever buy another one it will not be a Canon.  The tripod is a joke and the slots so small where the strap goes that I couldn't get the strap on.  The lenses cap fell off and cracked and will no longer fit.  The carrying case seems like it was not made for this specific camera as it's not roomy at all.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX530 HS Digital Camera with 50x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3-Inch LCD HD 1080p Video (Black)+ Extra Battery + 24GB Class 10 Card Complete Deluxe Accessory Bundle And Much More
review: Got this as a gift. Very humble and simple yet fun camera to use. The kit is even very good. My only complaint is the low battery life. Other than that, this is a great camera with a good super zoom on it. No eye view finder on it so it becomes some what complicated for me when just viewing the LCD screen only when I'm in super zoom mode. But using continuous shot mode I'm able to get clear photos of birds on trees that are a hundred yards away nearly. I'm even able to photograph airplanes flying through the sky but a little tricky to do. Overall a very decent camera with kit at a very affordable price. Fun to use for street photography. Taken photos of the stars, landscapes, models for modeling, animals, and just overall fun family pics. I give it four stars because of low battery life but a additional battery does come with the kit which helps tremendously. Thank you!,P.S. I love using manual mode on this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX530 HS Digital Camera with 50x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3-Inch LCD HD 1080p Video (Black)+ Extra Battery + 24GB Class 10 Card Complete Deluxe Accessory Bundle And Much More

review: I really like this camera❣️ It’s lightweight and easy to carry in the field. I also do a lot of photography from my car because of the tick problem in the northeast. I bought a nice windowpod here on Amazon to attach to my car window. The battery lasts a long time. It was reasonably priced too. It’s a great starter bridge camera with lots of zoom. No more attaching different lens. I only do photography as a personal hobby so I feel it takes nice sharp photos for my purposes. I don’t have to do much editing as Canon takes great quality photos right out of the box. I’m happy with this camera. I do miss having a view finder because it’s hard to keep my old self steady when taking wildlife photos 👵🏻😂

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I’m in love with this camera. This is my first real camera so I wanted something easy and this camera is pretty simple. Picture quality is clear. The camera itself isn’t too heavy. Also, the zoom is incredible!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The 18 megapixel photos are about the same quality as my last camera's 12MP photos. The sensor on this camera introduces a lot of noise at relatively low ISOs. The camera is also somewhat noisy, due mostly to the image stabilization, but still makes noise even when that is turned off.,The wifi features are good, but the UI behind them still needs work and is a bit slow for certain mundane tasks like uploading all the photos to a computer. It does support SMB shares, so that is a plus if you run linux. Controlling manual aperature, shutter speed, and focus still require going into a menu, so there is no fast way to control those.,The 4k videos come out alright, but for anything action based you will still want 1080p@60hz since the 30hz can be painful if whatever your shooting is moving around.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Easy to use and just perfect for my needs. Takes wonderfully clear, crisp interior room photos with excellent color. Very, very pleased.

review: I bought this camera for my granddaughter because I  have used an older model for the last 4 years and  it still provides me with clear photos with fantastic colors. For most amateur photographers (like myself) who need a good point-and-shoot camera, this one is a winner.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have had only a short while to use this. Takes great photos, but you do have to spend time learning the function mode settings. I feel that the ones offered: tiny camera, monochromatic, pinhole are all effects that you can easily add while editing your photos on the simplest photo editing sites. You cannot quickly add the effect, take a shot, then get rid of the effect. In fact, it is hard do get the camera out of the mode and back to reset. The most useful modes are macro and fish eye lens. Again, it takes some thumbing around to access those modes. Jury is still out.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I cannot stand this camera. I have had two Canon Powershot's before and loved them.  My last one just broke so I decided to buy this one before we went to Disney Land so some days I wouldn't have to lug my big Nikon DSLR around with me.  This model was a huge let down.  It had a slow response time, so when the camera finally did fire the people had already walked out of the frame. It wouldn't shoot rapid fire for mulitple frames and it had very poor low light capabilities.  I finally just gave up using it and got better results with my iphone by far.  I'm very disappointed.,Sadly I missed the return window so it looks like 5yr old and 9yr old will be getting to play with this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Terrible camera! Only a 30 day return window too, so I can't exchange it.,Don't waste YOUR money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Although a negative review I'm not here to just complain but hopefully help others make a decision. I'm not a pro wedding photographer, but I am an experienced photographer who has owned a variety of cameras over the years and I take the time to read features and instructions for each camera to get the best result. I picked this camera up a year ago for its small size, high MP and brand name. The amount of time it takes this camera to focus is simply disastrous. I have used numerous settings to take photos of sporting events, subject up close and far away. Blurry every time. If you are taking still shots in excellent natural light, you can get a decent photo. Under other lighting conditions, terrible! Night or low light? forget it, nothing comes out clear. Sports or moving objects - 1 out of a thousand will come out clean. Fact is I purchased this camera to get better pictures than my phone, turns out the phone easily beats this cheap toy from Canon. Again, i'm not a shaky handed novice photographer so trust me when I tell you, don't purchase this camera, go up to a higher level camera or stick to using your phone. Sony Cybershot cameras in the $150-$200 range have delivered the highest value to me over the years, this is what I'm going back to for a simple Point and Shoot.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is a great camera for the level just below the SLR.  It does not allow lens to be changed but it has a very wide range for zooming.  In fact the tele is so long that one must use a tripod unless it is in the brightest of light.  The zoom feature is on a toggle switch and not like SLR which would be on the lens.  Therefore, it is a little slower to change focal length.  The glass monitor is pretty large and bright.  The pictures are sharp as you should expect.  I am no connoisseur, just a hobbyist so I cannot give you a very sophisticated review on the optics.  Be aware that this camera, unlike many Lumix camera, does not carry the Leica lens designation.  On the other hand, that really isn't that important these days, from what I hear.  All in all, it is a versatile camera for those wanting a little more than a point and shot with a goodly wide range from wide angle to zoom.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have had this camera for a little over two weeks now and I can honestly say that is it a great camera if you are on a budget. With 20 mega-pixels this camera takes extremely clear pictures and amazing video (at 720p HD). The small design of this camera is great for taking trips and just placing it in your pocket.,BATTERY LIFE:,For the short amount of time I have had this camera, I cannot say too much about the battery life. I charged the battery when I first purchased the camera and have not had to recharge it since. Being a YouTuber, I shoot a lot of video and have used this camera on average 2.5 to 3 hours each day since I purchased it. I also take a lot of pictures with this camera (I have a dog who likes to sleep or sit in very odd positions), but again, I have not had to recharge since the first time.,20 MEGA-PIXEL & 8X OPTICAL ZOOM:,As stated previously I take a lot of pictures, and with the 20 mega-pixels this camera provides the pictures come out very clear and almost perfect. I say almost perfect because while it does take clear pictures the Smart AUTO feature does cause some problems if you are not taking pictures in idealistic settings.,With the 8x optical zoom I have noticed is not as good as other point and shoot cameras. Again this will depend on if you are shooting in idealistic settings, but on this camera it unfortunately does make the photo a little pixelated if you are trying to zoom in. Having taken a variety of pictures with the camera I have to say that unless you are shooting with extremely good lighting, the zoom on this camera should not be used past half of the full feature.,SMART AUTO:,Smart AUTO is honestly a great feature on this camera because you do not have to program your camera for every situation. The Smart AUTO feature does use 32 predefined shooting situations to determine the best settings for that specific shot, however, it does have its problems. The main issue with the Smart AUTO feature is that if you are taking pictures in less that ideal situations, the camera might choose settings that basically ruin the picture. For instance, when taking a picture of my dog at a dusk setting out in my backyard, the Smart AUTO feature chose the settings of an indoor close up shot. So while this is a great feature be prepared to run into some issues.,CONCLUSION:,While this camera does have a few flaws I do honestly believe it is an amazing point and shoot camera. All of the features do take some getting used to just like any other product out there. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who has a budget they need to stick with but still wants a great camera for either pictures or video.

The enclosed info booklet had such small print I needed magnifying eyeglasses PLUS a large magnifying glass to read it. And then it had little info of value other than FCC rules. To find operating instructions, I had to go to the Canon website where I had to download a manual that previously came with the camera. The manual was a staggering 216 pages! Previously the manual was a manageable 4 or 5 pages.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I purchased the ELPH 180 to replace my old Canon SD1000 that I have had for about 10 years but unfortunately there is a big difference. The ELPH 180 takes nice photos, but the case is cheap plastic. I will be fortunate if the cover for the battery/card compartment lasts a year. When I take photos I usually take the card out and put it in the computer, but I will not be able to do that any more. Instead I will have to use a mini USB cord. Yes, it is that flimsy.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I am so disappointed in this camera. I have always been a Canon girl and was looking for a replacement of the camera that I keep in my purse, my previous camera had reached a point to where the lens cover was not closing all the way, but it was several years old. With the new camera most of my shots are blurry or have a glare in them. So disappointed.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Poor quality photos.  After 5-10 photos it stops focusing properly even in daylight and in high contrast scenes.  After ruining many photos of events important to me, I finally learned that I have to turn it off occasionally so it can reset itself.  It would be nice if there was a firmware update to fix that.  Most lower-light photos are unacceptably grainy and out of focus because the camera seems to default to increasing ISO rather than operating the flash.  I think I have defeated that feature by finding the menu selection to force the ISO to 100 or 200 rather than letting the camera set it.  Even when operating at what I think is its best, colors seem dull.  I tried setting the colors to "vivid" and they turned out unnatural and with an orange cast.  Still experimenting with settings, but so far this is a big disappointment compared to my previous Canon pocket camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought an Elph 180 in August and took it straightaway on a major PCT SecJ backpacking trip (7 days). It was by far the lightest, most compact camera available at short notice, and I had had the previous model (2016) - and killed it using it in rain (photos recovered from SD Card)!!,Online reviews had dissed the Elph 180 battery life as limited to 220 per charge, so I started out rationing the number of photos I took daily, and with flash disabled.  However 5-6 days into the trip, the battery was still reading FULL, and I had taken over 150 mountain,  views, flower shots etc, so I let loose.,Total of 220 shots later (coincidence) it still read full and we reached civilization, with a bunch of GREAT photos - only issue was the wildfire smoke limiting the visuals.,I love this camera - but will now always keep it in a ziploc baggie on wet days.,Let's fix global warming!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Absolutely the best price we could find. Reasonably priced camera that takes good photos. Thanks!!! 5 STARS*****

With a Zeiss lens and at 20 mp, this camera underperforms my old Elph which cost $145, had a metal body, and took clear pictures all at 8mp.  Truly underwhelming, on top of adding a plastic body to the camera, giving it a cheap feel.,On the whole, a grand disappointment.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Bought this as an upgrade for my Sony W330 (which is an outstanding camera). I do not notice any significant improvements; so no "wow".  The macro focus and the low light sensitivy appear to be comparable to the W330; these are 2 of its best features. The panorama feature is a little disappointing as it only captures appx 60 degrees and often ends up with misalignments between frames. I have much better luck using an SLR and photostitching software to create superior 360 degree views. At max resolution, the time interval between frames seems really long due to the size of the files. I considered reducing the resolution, but then what's the point - - might was well just use my W330. Still if you're looking for a very compact and very versitile point-and-shoot, I do recommend the W830.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

I was considering purchasing FZ200 but couldn't justify the cost and FZ70 is 60x zoom vs FZ200 which is only 24x zoom.,I am disappointed though that FZ70 doesn't have capability and or plug in for external remote, although the zoom is excellent and you can get close enough to actually see the surface of the moon and or zoom in distant object or birds as they were at your hand reach. It is rather very difficult to remain steady and prevent shaking as the shake of your hand also multiplies 70 times. It is almost impossible to achieve zooming distant object without a tripod that is, if you want clear picture or movie without distortion but this isn't a camera's fault.,This camera can't be compared to DSLR's but rather is a good bargain in a bridge camera. There isn't enough right up or videos about this camera but I literally watched every video by Graham Houghton on YouTube about FZ200 and that helped me to decide purchasing FZ70 as the features and functions are nearly identical in these two cameras.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: We were having issues with our DSLR that needed repair and bought this for a holiday trip so we would still get better photos than the smart phone.  Surprised to find out seeing the overall good ratings that this took much worse photos than my wife's very old and outdated smart phone.,Every shot seems blurry and out of focus.  We've had simple Kodak and Canon models in the past (like upwards of 10 yrs ago) that took perfectly clear shots so I do not get what the issue is with this but I see a ton of reviews repeating the issues of blurry photos.  Unfortunately I don't see any suggestions on a fix.,Another thing that I am seeing that is aggravating is the slow response (shutter).  I brought this out again and was messing with it (it is now a toy camera for my 5 year old) and what I had forgotten to mention in my original review is the unbelievable delay from the time you click the button till the eventual flash and exposure.  I would focus click and then by the time the damn thing snaps, your subject has moved or changed positions.  Ever try to take photos of kids?  This reminds me of old pinhole cameras where you have to tell everyone to hold very still for 15 seconds while the film is exposed.

review: Excellent product, the quality to great. Takes wonderful pictures. It would have been nice if it can with an SD card.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Good simple camera with just enough extras to get you through, timer, pan shots etc.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great camera bought it as a gift - they loved it.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought the Cybershot model DSC-W230 many years ago. It is still going strong, although it developed lens dust/spots, which isn't unheard of for cameras. I bought the DSCW800 because I use these cameras for work, and worried the older one would give up, and wanted to have a replacement before I needed it.,Although this newer model has some advantages, one disadvantage is that the W800 has a difficult time focusing when recording in video mode, something the W230 never has a problem with. It doesn't matter what one is taking a video of, and under what light conditions. It just doesn't want to stay in focus very well. Eventually it will focus, but even if the camera is in a static position, it will go in and out of focus.,It took a long time from order to actually receiving it, which I didn't mind because I really like Sony products, but am disappointed that focusing and staying in focus is really makes it undesirable for taking video. Takes great photos though.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera for my 9 year old son. He saved up enough allowance to buy this himself. I have an expensive Canon camera that he seems me taking pictures with all the time and wanted one of his own.,Pros:,1-I was looking for a camera that was small,2- Has an easy interface to use for a novice,3- Has automatic settings for a novice,4-Has decent picture quality.,5-My son loves this camera and uses it all the time,Cons:,1-The automatic settings aren't sensitive enough so you need to be able to manipulate them (i.e. the flash can be took bright or too dim) to get pictures to turn out.,Overall, it's perfect for my young son. If you need something easy to learn and need something compact this is a great camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: The camera has really bad focus and nearly all the pictures we took were blurry.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: It's compact and easy to pocket but the clarity is mediocre, my phone gets a better picture when I use it over this camera. I expected a little more given the amount of pixels and the Sony reputation.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This Sony Digital Camera is one I bought as a gift for my niece out of state after reading several reviews. She is using it for grad school projects and has written to praise its performance.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: It was a gift for someone!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera after my old cyber shot broke. I opted to upgrade the MP but really do enjoy the brand. As other reviews stated, the zoom crops the photo, if you want something with real zoom, don't buy a point and shoot. If you want a lightweight camera that takes great photos, this would be your best purchase. It's very affordable and performs wonderfully. I photograph my sewn work, you can see the individual fibers in the fabric at the highest resolution, the weaving of the fabric! Very happy. The flash is pretty bright so be careful when using this for product photography as you might want to turn your flash off or flood out the colors

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I came to Amazon looking for a camera to take on vacations and trips. I only ever use my iPhone for pictures, and wanted to invest in something slightly more professional that wouldn't break the bank. I am in no way a photographer, but this camera sure makes me feel like one. It's the perfect size for travelers, as it fits in your hand perfectly, as it's very small and portable. I think the picture quality is absolutely stunning. I can zoom into a tree from over 100 feet away and it looks as if I'm right in front of it! I haven't taken this camera on my trip to Europe yet, but will update and post the pictures I take once I do. I've mostly just played around with it, taking pictures of my dog or sister. I included a selfie to show the flash - that was taken in a pitch black room. I wasn't even sure it would come out clear, but wow! Look at the quality!,One thing I would like to address is the wifi, which might be my favorite thing about this camera as a whole. I contemplated buying the Canon powershot SX410, which is a cheaper, slightly older version of this camera, but opted for this because of the wifi feature. I can't boast about it enough. I can take a picture of something, click on the wifi option on the camera, connect to the wifi from my phone, open the free camera app and send the picture directly from my camera to my iPhone. I can also delete that picture from the camera once I've saved it to my phone, so I'll never run out of space! The battery life is also very impressive and it seems to stay charged for a long time (another reason it's great for travelers). And the time it takes to fully charge the battery isn't long at all.,I'm just a person who wanted a cool camera to take nice quality pictures. I'm not a photographer or anything near, but I love clean, crisp quality shots. If you want a small, portable camera that takes AMAZING quality pictures, has a KILLER zoom and flash, and has a wifi feature that allows you to share your pictures on social media in the matter of seconds after taking the picture, this is for you. This camera should be so much more expensive that it is because it's absolutely amazing. 10/10 recommend!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I don't have a lot of photography or non-phone camera experience. So, I really just jumped into the DSLR world with this camera. Having this for a week, I really enjoy it for how much it can do.,Seems like a lot of the reviews here are people that don't understand how cameras work (ISO, aperture, shutter speed). You DO NOT have full control over aperture or shutter speed. It's an entry level camera. If you want full control, buy a Rebel T5! The specs are not professional either (they're mid-range at best), so don't expect your quality of pics to be super awesome starting out, you need practice. This camera is a tool, you have to control it. It's not going to take great pics by itself!,Here's a few of my favorite pics I've taken in the past week. Enjoy! :)

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: When I first received this camera, I wrote a  review saying I loved it. The photos were super sharp, and the zoom was amazing. It's so easy to use. However, now, a few months after I received it, it suddenly broke. One day, I used it and everything was fine; the next day, for some reason, the zoom lens wouldn't retract and a message popped up telling me to "restart the camera." I had not dropped the camera. I kept it in the camera bag, and had no reason to think it had suffered any trauma. I tried multiple times to restart the camera, but it didn't help. I called Canon, and they suggested I send it to them. Instead, I found an authorized Canon dealership nearby. They saw the camera was still under warranty, and took it in for me to send it themselves to Canon. Today, I was informed that Canon will charge me $93.20 to repair the camera because, they say, the lens is not under warranty. The camera store told me that the lens is the most vulnerable part of the camera. Needless to say, I am very disappointed.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The canon power shot sx420 is a neat little “point and shoot” camera. Great focal length (see chameleon and fork pictures) good zoom that stays clear and doesn’t get grainy. This was a gift for some one who thought they might like to get into photography but doesn’t understand terms like iso.,I think this will be a good camera for a beginner as it allows you to change picture resolution, light and focus while looking, but has a feature where it tells you the photos info so you can understand.,Usually a Nikon fan but same price range you can’t get wifi enabled- this has WiFi - and it works well! You need to dig a bit to find the camera functions and not everything is as intuitive as I’d like, but I would say overall very good.,Compact size makes a big difference for this camera. It’s very light and handles well.,Night mode is fairly good- husky photo was low light. You need to figure out the settings with in the mode- but it’s doable.,I took away one star because with everything it DOES do, you should be able to do more outside of the “auto” mode. Will update review once present is assessed by giftee-

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: At first I was thrilled with this camera because the wi-fi features worked right out of the box.,This impressed me. I was quick to review and give it a high rating. I was too quick.,Week after week I started to notice that the shutter speed was too darn slow.,If a subject moves or twitches even the slightest bit, there is a blur.,Canon support, to their credit, is quick to respond, but the suggestions they offer do not work.,There is no setting that seems to impact the shutter speed (even the ISO setting.) It seems the shutter opens for almost a half to 3/4 of a second.,The only pictures that come out decent are ones taken indoors with the flash.,But using bright, available light or exterior bright light yields way too much motion blur.,I bought this camera to show my daughter how a real camera compared to her phone camera.,I lost that argument. Despite the high megapixel feature and big lens... the pictures are really poor. Grainy and blurry.,They other problem is the camera can't focus when fully zoomed in. Maddening. Try to take a picture of a distant object and adjust thefocus while zoomed in; Blur.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: What a wonderful camera!  It's light.  It's photos are SO REAL.  And it's SO EASY to operate.  I bought it in RUBY RED, and I can FIND IT anywhere, even in the dark.  Its battery holds an extended charge for many photos.,I bought a couple of backup batteries and a backup charger to have on hand.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Very hard to control zoom,need a stand to steady the shot. great shots a mile away!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: First I bought a Coolpix which had wifi. I never could get the wifi to transfer pics to my iPad and the camera was too small and the controls too close to each other to operate the camera. After I found the Coolpix a new home, I bought this Powershot SX420.,First, the camera is large enough to hold still and to operate the controls. I have arthritis, my hands are a little stiff but I can use this camera without any problem. The thumb rest beside the movie button didn't stop my thumb from sliding, so I put a small square of sticky back Velcro there to use for a thumb grip. Problem solved.,The wifi is very easy set up. Pictures transfer painlessly to my pad or the photo printer.,The long zoom makes the SX420 a great kayaking camera. Pictures of wildlife along the shoreline are very clear.,This is a great little camera to have fun with when you're tired of your big camera that seems to take itself so seriously.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: As it's name, compact camera. Very cute and small, light weigt camera.  In addition simple working deiVce. No bluetooths but using wifi, can transper photos and video. Not super but normal.So simple work.Another is nikon d-3400. As you see so small n compact with description also.,Delivery took 11days.Thanks.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: It is pretty much point & shoot with a  short telephoto lens. Easy to use & good pics & transferring via WiFi is a boon.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: small camera , great pic's the best camera for traveling

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Every time I travel with my friends, I use my friend's micro-single, and my heart is really envious. This time, before I traveled, I used my own small vault to configure myself with a camera. It’s amazing to experience it, especially with the handle, it’s easy to take a selfie without pressure.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Good prices and small portable camera easy to put in our purses or pockets. Pretty good pictures can not ask more with this prices. Thanks .

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought this camera because I needed a new one (my old 5mp camera broke) and was looking forward to getting higher resolution pics.  My prior camera had produce pics at 480dpi.  This camera produces huge pics - but at 180 dpi at best.,Combined with the need to get out the card reader, remove the card and put in the card reader every time I need to download photos (I usually take 1-2 photos at a time so this is close to every photo) rather than just plugging in as with the prior camera, it is quite inconvenient.,I thought I was getting a camera that takes higher resolution photos and I did not.  Unfortunately for various reasons I had no need to use it until after the take-back date, so did not realize the problems until too late and I'm stuck with it now.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought one a few wks ago.  Grainy and blurry when you use zoom all the way out even if balancing camera against a tree.  Close ups of flowers are also blurry unless about 2 ft away.  Had a Fugi point and shoot,  Dropped it and it broke so thought I was upgrading to this one.  Would love to find another Fugi as much better quality.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought this before reading the reviews I am sorry to say. When I went on a trip and tried to take scenery photos it would not focus most of the time. I tried to capture sunsets, and the auto focus kept switching to macro......and photos were very blurry. Wish I had my old Sanyo which took great photos, but the battery door finally broke off. I will be trying to return this Canon when I return from my trip

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I was looking for a camera to take some better macro photos than my DSLR would.  I remember the good old days when I had an Olympus point and shoot that took amazing macros.  So far I've been disappointed.  It takes OK photos, but doesn't capture the detail I'm looking for.  I am going to give a few more chances by fiddling with some of the settings, but if it doesn't improve I'll be returning it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera was purchased for a preschool to capture images of all our wonderful friends.. Easy to use, great result.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: There is an obvious defect in this camera where it doesn't take clear pictures and doesn't want to focus.,I am an insurance adjuster and so I use the camera almost daily.  I called Canon and they said that I needed to send it in...which means I have to purchase another camera so I can continue working.  I read through the reviews and there are others complaining about it so I'm glad to know it's not just me.  I bought it because I needed a basic camera to take pictures and nothing more...I didn't realize that Canon now made garbage unless you spent more money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have only used Canon cameras my whole life, both personal and professional. This is the first camera that I have owned that takes terrible pictures (all are blurry or out of focus) . Maybe one out of ten pictures come out clear. What a waste of money on this one. It hasn't turned be away from Canon cameras yet. Now my grand-kids have a new play toy (an expensive one). If I could, I would have given it a zero - stars.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The camera is a nice replacement for an older model from another brand. The time stamp can be customized to display date and time the picture was taken, which is a nice feature. Video recording could be a bit better, but it does the job. Very happy with this purchase.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: First BAD Canon I've owned!  I bought this camera for my son's wedding.  So many pictures are so out of focus that we can not use them.  A once in a lifetime event and most of my pictures are trash!!

review: I love the zoom on this camera. Took some amazing shots of the moon during an eclipse.

Overall  nice camera with many excellent features.

review: I've used this Camera for over a year now. Amazing zoom and amazing image quality. Unbeatable at this price point. No issues whatsoever.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

review: I am in the "how to" part yet, but just did my first work with video with this and it's incredible even in low light escenes. Great pictures but I think that there's some kind of too much noise on them, but still great. Amazing videos at 60 fps and the zoom is just crazy with its 60x. It has some features that will blow your creativity away. Sometimes I love the wide angle lens and other times hate it, but in general it is an excellent camera to work with.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great camera! I highly recommend setting it to -2 noise reduction for better image quality, though. Can't beat the price and value.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

review: I own a Canon SLR, two Fuji bridge cameras, two Olympus point and shoot and one other Panasonic pocket point and shoot.,By far, this is the best camera I have.  Love the zoom (WOW!!)  Really great stabilization.,I am shooting the neighbors flowers one petal at a time.,Really love this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is more camera than I've ever used.  I love it so much.  Last week I had to travel for business and I shot through the water into the sand and got a clear view of the shore.  I also shot a fast moving creek and it stopped the action with the water in motion.  If you are just starting your time as a serious photographer I would heartily recommend this camera.  If you're unsure of setting it will do it for you, if you want to experiment you can do that too.  I did look into bridge cameras and this particular was rated number one on several consumer sights.  Enjoy yourself.  So much fun and such a big reward.  I'm hooked.  When I figure out how, I'll include some of the photos I've taken.
