review: Had it on a charger for two days, switched sockets even, it  simply does not hold a charge and shows zero battery life continuously. Turns off the second it's off the charger. We requested a refund and sending it back. Quality control has really gone down, every other order either damaged or a dud:-( Afraid to order another, what are the odds of getting a working,  quality tested product? Especially sad considering we finally saved up for a camera to take family photos and pictures of my artwork, our phones are cheap, old ones and can't take normal photos. I was so excited to receive it only to find out it's just a useless piece of plastic:-(((

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: a nice unit. works well...not a high priced camera, but for many applications it is quite functional..i cannot think of any complaints....

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: As another reviewer posted, "I tried to like this camera"... It can take very nice photos BUT writing to SD card after a shot is extremely slow. No quick, multiple action shots with this camera., Zoom is great BUT a Tri-pod is recommended to eliminate blur.  Wi-Fi connection is more complicated than it needs to be.  Battery compartment has a tiny switch/lever that makes insertion not necessarily a pain, but tricky  As I already have a Rebel T3,  I was looking for a smaller pocket size camera but this just wasn't it.  Good entry level but not for me.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: So far this digital camera has been great. Was very easy to set up and takes nice photos. The camera does require a digital card in order to save photos. I purchased one separately from Amazon for 13.00. There is a small strap that comes with the camera. The shutter speed is good but you can not take fast moving shots with this camera. It is better suited for portraits and still life.,The camera is not heavy so would be easy to take with you on a tour. I would also recommend buying a camera bag with the camera to protect it from being scratched or hit. Another nice feature is the Wi-Fi. It was easy to download photos to my laptop without having to connect to it.  I saved around 70 from purchasing this camera on Amazon versus best buy.,Very happy with the purchase and will be using this on my trips!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I bought this camera to get close up shots of the moon.  I got three really beautiful shots - OUT OF THIRTY!  I was using a tripod, but still the photos came out blurry.  Most of the photos I took inside were really blurry as well.  The user settings are far from intuitive and the lag time between pressing the shutter button and the picture being taken is excruciatingly slow.,Maybe this camera is defective, but after reading other reviews, I suspect this is simply a terrible camera.  I'm returning the camera and just sticking with the camera on my Galaxy S9.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Return window closed September 5th - Lens error began September 9th.  This is the second camera that has lasted less than a year due to lens  retraction problems. Really sad because for its price range you can get some rally great shots with this one.  I was hoping for something to take on hikes and trail rides - this it not it.  Back to my old one Kodak.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: This camera takes fantastic pictures outside! I went to Disney World and Disney on Ice with it. My Disney World pictures came out fantastic. My Disney on Ice pictures were mostly terrible. It all has to do with lighting. I’ve tried several different settings. I purchased the camera with the intent of using it for the parade as well as the Flower and Garden Festival in Disney World. I know it will be great for that! It’s a great beginner camera. Light weight. Easy to use. FANTASTIC ZOOM!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I'm still trying to learn how to use. Get a tripod for the magnified shot. Easy to move shots to my iPad. Gives fast turnaround to get it to Facebook or E-Mail.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Amazing pictures! I love my camera so much. You can get beautiful pictures out of this camera, with out needing to spend 400$ on some camera to get the same quality. Its the photograper skill more so than the camera. Practice makes perfect for sure with this camera. I'm by no means a professional. But I do take many many photos. From people to still life to the moon. I love taking photos of the moon. But anyways, this camera is a wonderful option.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: This camera is great. It does everything I needed, expected it to do and more. It is amazing for the price. I bought this camera to take pictures for our neighborhood and also to take pictures for art that I am doing. It picks up the detail amazingly, and prints from this camera come out beautifully. I have no negative reviews about this camera, I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a camera to take amazing photos and last for awhile.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I am an artist who needed a simple new camera for my colorful artwork (and for personal nature hike photos). I have used the camera for a couple of weeks now (still figuring out some of the settings), but I am super happy with it so far. The color seems good, the zoom works well (though can be a bit grainy on super large shots). I shot the moon photo the second day I had the camera. I am really pleased that the self-timer will remain ON from shot to shot instead of having to re-set every time - very handy! The length of the lens takes a bit of getting used to, but I do like the way this feels in my hand compared to a rectangular point-and-shoot. The largest image resolution is HUGE and will yield crisp prints at a smaller size. I am very glad I ultimately chose this Canon PowerShot SX420 out of the literally dozens of cameras I researched over a month's time! (Photos: I bumped up saturation in post editing on the close up of the 1 " and 2" crystals, the moon was shot on a tripod (I never shot the moon before, so that was an exciting result).

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I wish I wouldn’t have spent the money. Very poor picture quality. My phone takes more clear pics than this camera. I should’ve returned it.

review: I bought the 180 as a pocket walk around camera that I can take with me on a daily basis vs my dslr(s). I've only had it a couple of days so far, but it's a pretty nice little camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: it's a very small camera and fits in the pocket. I bought it for a vacation in which I don't want to risk taking my expensive iphone to.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Very tiny,  not a 5" screen! Returned.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I *CANNNOT* recommend this camera.  The day after purchasing the Canon PowerShot ELPH 180, I was taking pictures in a museum with family.  Everything was going well and it appeared the camera was pretty good (I left everything on the factory settings).  Every now and then I'd review the pics I took.  Then at one point in the day the camera suddenly gave a 'memory card lock' error and wouldn't take any more pictures.  I was also unable to review any pictures already taken.  I figured maybe it was feature of the camera that once you hit the memory card limit it would 'lock' the card or something.  So I didn't worry as I figured the pictures were still there and I could just transfer them onto my PC or Mac.  When I got home and tried that, both my PC and MAC didn't recognize the SC card.  Nothing.  Zip.  Not only did I lose all of my pictures but the camera fried the SD card to the point that it isn't recognized anymore and can't be reformatted.  I had some IT folks check the card out too thinking maybe I was missing something and they also confirmed, after trying two separate machines, that the SD card was ruined.  The SD card was only three months old and had been working perfectly until used in the camera.  Needless to say, I returned the camera and am very disappointed.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA and would give it zero stars if I could!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Good camera for my Animation student to do stop motion with.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Autofocus does NOT always work.: several times I had to power it off and then power it back on to focus a shot.,Also, telephoto/indoor photos are too grainy.,Too many confusing options.  I've accidentally selected an unknown option and could not figure out how to undo it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I can't get enough of how well the camera shots video.  The HD video is just wonderful.  The only problem I see with the camera is the microphone on it.  The microphone will pick up wind and make the audio hard to hear.  But overall it's a great starter camera for vloggers.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought this camera as a travel camera for a recent vacation. I own 2 other Canon Cameras (Rebel and 7D) so I had faith that this would be an easy, good quality camera. I returned this item after using it for 4 days. I tried it in low light (poor quality, difficult to focus, blurry) and daylight (over-saturated, but not terrible), and shade (difficult to focus, slow). If I were taking photos only of outdoor, well lit subjects, this camera would be fine for someone who wasn't going to edit or resize the photo.  Also, the focus on the camera is not in the center. Even when I was taking a portrait, with the subjects face taking up 70% of the screen, the camera would still chose to focus on the top left or right of the background.  Even for vacation snapshots, the quality wasn't good enough for me so I returned it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Got it as a gift for low tech MOL. She loves it. It's small and lightweight and takes great pics. Perfect alternative to filling up the phone space with pics and videos of your grand children ;-)

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)

Way to go Sony!! Like the fact that it covers the lens of camera when off and it shuts off automatically . I am old school and have a great deal to learn about all the functions on this camera. Where I work we have 20 of them and I use one off and on so that is where I first learned of this camera. Light weight and very thin. Everyone should have one of these if they don't have a smart phone camera.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: This says "USB cable" as the connection method, they fail to mention that the "B" connector is a proprietary connector.  The included cable is far too short and won't even let me sit the camera on my desk while plugged in to a front USB connector.  Apparently Sony wants to force you to buy a cable from them, even if you have a dozen cables that fit 99%+ of modern devices.,I'll be returning this and getting one from a manufacturer that doesn't think the "U" in "USB" means "U buy cables from us".

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Bought as a starter camera for my younger brother this Christmas. Works well, easy to operate, is a great quality product.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: A nice camera.  Small and maybe a bit too light for steady holding, common to all light cameras.  Long battery run time. Computer I/F & charging cable is non-standard on the camera end - buy a spare cable on Amazon.  A standard SD card will fit. A real photog plus is that the flash exposes for the focus distance, not a general scene exposure which usually results in overexposure on object close to the camera and underexposure on the focus objects.  Another plus is that the battery is held by a latch inside the camera, not by a battery door spring.  I normally set the resolution on 5Mpixels due to uploading to the Internet.  I increase to full resolution when needed.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Although this item had several strong complimentary reviews, I found the photo lense to be fuzzy when viewing compared to iPhone or Samsung phone cameras.  I am disappointed with the product.  The flash feature is also very delayed, which makes picture taking slow.  I don't recommend this camera.  You will be better off to spend more and get a better quality experience.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I've had this only a few days and glad I have it.  I bought it to take pics of the total eclipse of the sun on Aug. 21.  I've been aiming it at the sun - WITH APPROPRIATE FILTER -  and the 1000 mm lens is  tolerably good.  Blue Bonnets in my back yard 75 yards away are very sharp. Haven't been able to shoot the sun yet.  I have used a Canon AE-3 and a pair of 500mm mirror lenses for a number of years and this camera seems equal to them.  It is extremely light weight and very easy to operate.  One thing I dislike intensely about all digital cameras I've seen is a lack of a facility for a cable release.  With a 1000mm lens a cable release seems indispensable. So far that is the only drawback of this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I took advantage of buying a Refurbished Camera and saving at least $80 over all the other SX420's available at that time. In fact, I was a little concerned about the quality because of the very low price, $100. When I opened the box which arrived right on time I was pleasantly surprised. It looks like and functions like a new camera. I am very happy with the seller and the quality of the camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Good Camera, not as fast as i will like it to be though. Pics takes approx 7 secs to allow for the next one.,Am i doing something wrong?,Also, the battery holds charge for approx 2 hrs. it goes dead overnight. It is on Eco mode.,However really good pics and video.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I bought the red one for myself and absolutely love it.  I find the stabilizer works well and my pictures are sharp - mostly photos of people in casual settings.  After 6 weeks I bought a black one like it for our office and while I think I have set the settings the same I am not sure the pictures are as sharp!  Maybe my eyes have gotten worse (a possibility as I am awaiting surgery) or maybe there is a glitch in the second camera.  The original reviews showed some significant variation from 'clear sharp photos' to 'not happy with clarity of photos'  -- so maybe the black one has some issues as I am same photographer now trying a second one for our office.  Again, I love the red one I got first and stabilization/clarity of photos was one of the main reasons I chose this camera.  I only purchased the second for our office after practicing/testing the first one for 6 weeks.  The jury is still out on the 2nd purchase (a black one so there is no question which is which!)

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Both pond sample pictures were taken hand-held through a double-pane window about 35 feet from the subjects.  The turkey vulture picture was taken through a double-pane window, hand-held and about 175 feet away.  Those who complain about picture quality are doing something wrong.  I now own two of these cameras--almost instant on so you can capture great shots.  The amazing thing is the equivalent 35mm camera focal length on the lens is 1,000 mm when in pure optical zoom.  Inexpensive, fast, great picture quality and fantastic image stabilization--no tripod needed.  If you're looking for great flash, you're looking at the wrong camera.  I know a thing or three about cameras and photography; simply, you don't need to know anything to take great pictures with these.  You can remove the SD card or hook directly to computer with USB cord.  Apparently Wi-Fi is another feature which I haven't attempted.  Buy this camera and impress your friends with the great pictures you take!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The camera was the perfect size. Unfortunately when i used it to record videos thw auto zoom noise is picked up on the microphone plus there is no aux for an additional mic.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The camera itself takes good pictures, but then most cameras these days are just as good.,This review is about only copying pictures from camera to Computer. Not dumb, stupid, and weak smartphones.,Once you get the camera configured and connected to your Wireless network:,1. You have to press camera wireless button to connect.,2. You start the program on your computer to either import all or copy what you want.,3. You *can not* take pictures while connected to the computer.,4. On the camera now you have to disconnect from wireless, in order to take more pictures.,This is completely unusable, it would be just as easy to take the SD card out of the camera and copy the files, or use a USB cable connected to the camera/computer.,People don't care about cameras, people care about the pictures and copying pictures where they want them.,1. Getting pictures off the camera to a Computer is poor, it works but very inconvenient.,2. The defunct company Eye-Fi had this working better than any company I have found (ten years ago).,3. I never tested the Cloud based upload, nor the smartphone features.,For those of you who have never seen or had an Eye-Fi wireless card: The process of getting pictures to your computer is incredibly simple:,1. Just turn the camera on and shoot pictures, a hundred if you like. The pictures just show up on your computer, without any interaction.,Eye-Fi (now defunct), Originally the software for the eye-fi sucked just like all the rest as it was CLOUD based. But the final software they released (because they shut down their cloud service), was designed to connect to your computer directly using WiFi.,It worked flawlessly.,-Cheers

A professional photographer friend told me jokingly that he hated me because it took him $15,000.00 worth of camera and lenzes to get that kind of clarity and closeness with his big 500 mm lenz and his Nikon. review: This is a fabulous camera - especially for the $249 that I paid for it. Pictures are outstanding.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I  had  the FZ47 and have the FZZ00. The FZ47 was a great bargain priced all around camera. The FZ200 has the F/2.8 max aperture lens (from 25mm to 600mm), which makes it a favorite for people who need fast shutter speeds in an affordable package. The FZ70 is, to me, a pumped up FZ47 with double the zoom range. The picture quality is decent and, in good lighting, very good. There is some geometric distortion at full wide angle. If it bothers you, you can correct it in software.  It focuses pretty fast, faster, I think, than the FZ47. Its top burst mode is fast, but shallow - about 3 shots in half a second. In this way, it's much inferior to the FZ200, which fires off shots like a machine gun and goes over 10 shots before pausing briefly to process them. The FZ200 has an articulating LCD scree while the FZ70 doesn't. The EVF is also much sharper in the FZ200.,This is not a camera for someone to take to a night time HS football game under the lights. It simply won't get you a fast enough shutter speed to freeze the action as the max aperture at full zoom is F/5.9. However, it could be useful for soccer moms and dads for daylight games. No part of a football field or soccer pitch would be too far for the sideline fan.  It would also be useful for football and baseball fans who sit far from the field and want to get shots of their favorite coaches or players from high up in the stadium during day games. Other people who might like this camera include real estate agents who can get "the whole house" easily at the 20mm setting and amateur enthusiasts taking pictures of large groups at work or school.,Its intelligent auto mode is actually pretty sharp, picking the appropriate mode (portrait, landscape, night time portrait, low light, etc.).,It's not an upgrade from the FZ200. It's an upgrade from the FZ60. However, for less than 400 bucks in the US, I think it's a  good deal.,If you are a photographic perfectionist, a so-called "pixel peeper", don't get this camera. Spend the money and get a DSLR with a good lens or two. It will probably cost you well over $1,000. It will not give you the reach you have with this camera.,This camera is like a decent decathlete - it can do lots of things pretty well, but it won't match the "specialists" in their strengths.,I like this camera and recommend it. However, if you are happy with "just" 25-600mm and can spend $150 to $200 more, consider the FZ200. It's the gold medalist for "decathlete" cameras.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

review: Only had this a few days, but so far I am impressed. I wanted a small camera that I could carry at all times, with a descent optical zoom and not pay to much for. Picture quality is great for this size of camera and it is very easy to use.Has some great settings on it to get some cool effects and the video quality is brilliant. review: I love that it has a wrist strap and little bag to store the camera in. She's having a grand time taking photos. We bought an SD card for 10 bucks to store the photos on; I'm not sure the camera would store them without it. Since it isn't marketed for children with a colorful kid-proof body or built-in games (which I really didn't want), it feels like the grown-up item that it is. It's easy enough to operate without reading the manual although some of the butttons are tiny and hard to see without reading glasses. The pictures are clear. I'd even recommend this for an adult who wants a basic camera with few frills.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter-in-law to take pictures of my new grandson. The only camera she had was her phone. This camera is small enough to fit inside a diaper bag or small purse. The only thing is it does have to be periodically charged and one may forget to check it before that "must have" picture. Still, it's a good camera & she loves it!

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Got this camera to use on vacation. The image stabilization is good if you only have minor movement and the zoom works pretty well. The camera struggle a little in low lighting but most shot footage outside which worked great. Overall, this camera was exactly what we were looking for. It was something cwe could take over seas to capture memories with but wouldn't hurt the bank if it was lost, broken or stolen.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I’m a fairly lazy person when it comes to returns, but I’m actually returning this purchase. To be fair to the company, shipping was much faster than expected which was great since I purchased this for my impatient 6 year old. However, quality of the product is FAR below the reviews. The camera is very cheaply made and feels like it’ll break in your hands at any moment. There is a switch on the side of the camera that changes between close up and scenic views that feels like it’s going to break the whole camera every time I use it. The camera never focused for any image (I’m experienced with photography and couldn’t get it to focus) and after fully charging the battery for over 15 hours it died after only 3 pictures. I would strongly urge you to reconsider purchasing this product and go with a better known proven point and shoot. For the time being my 12 year old Olympus point and shoot is still a significantly better option for my son and I’m disappointed that I even gave this a try.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I used this camera from previous employer. I am no longer at that company so off I went to my local Amazon and now I am the proud owner of this wonderful camera! Size of camera is GREAT! Easily slips into my purse or pocket. Removable memory card (need to purchase separately). Quickly down loads all images and videos on computer.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: This is such a cute camera. It is similar in size to my phone so I can carry it around with me.The pictures it takes are pretty good! Not the highest quality digital camera, but I got this for the nostalgia feel and the instant photos. The camera acts more like a printer where the images come out fully developed compared to the slow develop of older instant photos.I love the fact that I can have a digital copy of the photos so I can give them away to friends.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: This will make a perfect birthday gift for my 11-year-old nephew, who enjoys taking "professional" photos and videos for his family and friends. 18 Mega Pixels,1080P high definition resolution, and a LCD display, this camera is a professional device. And extended storage should be enough for him to take many photos and videos. I've played with it for a little bit. It was easy to operate, and the picture/video quality were great. I'm sure he'll be very excited and happy to receive this gift.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: My daughter who is 7 took pics of all the family, the pictures are so retro ( and flattering) , yes the film can be pricey but the pictures everyone was admiring! We will keep them forever in a lovely pink album!,The chunky, easy to use design means all ages can manage it- not a lot can go wrong! Would definitely recommend a present that keeps on giving and encourages creativity

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Got this for my 8 year old daughter for birthday gifts as she loves taking pictures. She was so happy with it and has taken lots of pictures. Some aren’t always great but the majority of them are great for the size. I think she will capture lots of memories with this.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: I am still wondering why a wrist strap was included with the camera when there is no place to attach it!  I like the size and the way it is easily carried in my hand.  Looking forward to the extra pixels of this Cyber Shot model.  Amazing how the price has come down and the number of pixels has increased over my last purchase.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Works great and Im happy with this camera, great value

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Needed a simple camera. Works really well and takes gorgeous photos. I have no complaints. The price is unbeatable.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Nice little camera!

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Really disappointed.... a very cheaply made camera.  Not worth $100.  I would price this camera around $40.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Works very well.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: As someone who takes photos just for pleasure, I don't need, nor want, a fancy camera.  This is perfect for me and for my photographic needs.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: given this to test for a review and its the best camera ive come across, very good shots, close ups and can record amazing quality .

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: A bit disappointed in this camera.  At first, it took good pics.  Broke within first 2 weeks.  It would not turn on and would not accept a charge.  Went through many calls ....attempts to get through to the dept for service as it was covered under warrantee...spent a lot of time on hold and disconnects before getting through to someone.  Sent the camera to a service place.  Waited for weeks.  Sent email for status.  Heard nothing.  Suddenly received a strange call asking if a replacement was acceptable.  A few more weeks went by and a new camera arrived.  The replacement was a different color, but not an issue as it has been working so far.  Take your chances on this one.  I would not recommend.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Pictures are sharp and clear.  The options are simple to use and the compactness is great.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Good camera

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: it's awful...it's super slow, lots of spots, flash sux and only fires when it wants to, I HATE THIS CAMERA!!!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Takes great pics. Accessories are good, especially 32GB card and reader to transfer pics to computer, well made double zippered camera case with an inside pocket for extra batteries, a padded memory card wallet and a screen protector with squeegee. The tripod is for tabletop or a surface that might not be perfectly level., so you can adjust the legs accordingly and that is OK for occasional use or traveling light. For my purposes, I purchased an excellent Amazon Basics tripod $14.95 and a $4.00 USB that's fits the ELPH 180 which gives me a 2nd way to upload pics to the computer.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The camera works great; however, be cautious of the memory card.  I lost a lot of great pictures because the memory card didn't function all of a sudden.  Although it offers 32GB memory card, I was unable to get any use of it and had to replace it with another card for the time being.  It would be highly beneficial to replace the memory card.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: We cannot install the wrist tether because the plastic under the metal is solid and will not allow the cord on the wrist tether through.,I have sent this vendor an email and I am waiting to hear back before returning.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: For the money, I don't think that you can find a better camera.  It's especially nice that it comes with a rechargeable battery.  I purchased this for my dad, who is about 80 years old.  The camera is very easy to use, so it's perfect for him!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This was a gift.  The recepients have not used the camera yet but plan to do so this week.  I can provide feedback later.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I liked it because it is versatile and useful and makes a good gift!. Although it took some getting used to, I started to get the hang of it. And by the way, I am giving it as a Christmas gift and I just wanted to test it out before I gave it to my mom. :)

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Very satisfied with product.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle

review: Very portable but pics are mostly blurry. I'd return if I had receipt. Upgraded to DSLR already

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: very handy

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Not worth it. The auto focus is a big problem and the picture quality in general is not very good at all.,It was a big waste of money.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great little camera, very easy to use and it takes great pictures...love the fact that it has a rechargeable battery, my old camera used AAA batteries and it went thru them like crazy, a charge on this camera lasts me quite awhile...If you are not a pro photographer and just need an all around camera that's easy to use, this is it.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Home run great value.  Takes great pictures for a point and shoot.  Needed a camera anyone can use and this is it.  Great for novas or expert

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Pure junk! I’ve owned Sony digital cameras for years. So when we’re headed out on a family vacation I ordered this for my teen son to use as he wanted... DOA! Turning the camera on the first time resulted in a loud crunching and popping sound as the lens deployed. Followed by a message to turn the camera off and back on. That second cycling resulted in the lens now jammed out and the same error message. Obviously QA has gone out the window at Sony. I’ll be contacting Sony to see what their solution is but this one caused disappointment and was a total fail. Sony, what happened to you?

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Nice camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: My daughter loved this camera.  Easy to carry.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Good camera got the wrong charger but was corrected fast.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I like the camera for several reasons.  It's compact, operations are easy to use, has a nice sized screen, and for all the features, it's not complicated

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: For the money it's a good utility camera capable of taking relatively good pictures.  It's very small and if you have large hands as I do you might consider a larger camera.  One issue you need to be aware of and they don't include it in the product description is this camera DOES NOT COME WITH A CARD. Also it does not include a carrying case nor is one available from Kodak.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I was excited when I got and I love  it now

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: my wife loves it

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I am a total amateur when it comes to photography but I like to share pics of my dogs with friends and family.  This camera takes great pics, and the quick video option is so handy!  I have a medical condition that leads to a loss of feeling in my fingers but this camera fits well in my hand and I don't feel like I'm going to drop it when I'm moving my fingers around to use the buttons.  I love this little camera!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I purchased the camera for my mom, an early Christmas present. She wanted a camera to take pictures of my son's wedding. The camera worked on and off before the batteries had to be changed. In a 24hr period, the batteries were changed 3x. :(  She was able to take a few good pictures of the wedding and reception. By the time she returned home, the camera was not working. The return policy had expired by then. She still wants a camera, any suggestions.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Easy to use and download. This was a purchase for someone new to photography, and a bit wary of technology. The camera performed, served its purpose as a chronicler of a road trip adventure. And it uses regular batteries, not special batteries.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)

review: Just got this camera today. I've been shooting video on it and taking photos. I think it's a good quality. Obviously there are better cameras but this is just perfect for what I need right now.Great for the price

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Not the best from Canon, as I bilevel the S110 series provide better color and low light support. This camera in low light will produce blurry pictures!!!! Some time, it take a good 5 seconds for the camera to shoot because it's auto focus is really slow. It works great during day time. The color do bleed some time, and flash is overpowering some time when there are objects around that reflect the lighting...

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: i expected this camera to have a little better screen clarity than it does but it gets the job done,nice sturdy camera for just shooting the breeze with

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: No matter what the setting, the picture quality is horrible. Video is nice enough, but I wanted it for photos!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: So far it's exactly what I wanted.  Good grip, one hand operation, red (easy to see if lost) color, great easy shots!  Check out the pic I took of a wolf spider in our terrarium the first day using the camera.  Too cool!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: i shouldn't have had super high expectations but at the end of the day it's a pretty decent camera. the only things i don't like is the camera's shutter speed and how blurry a photo can get with the slightest movement.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I I'm hoping the camera lens will be okay. I'm testing it for the next couple of days. We heard the package hit the front porch so it was not set down by the On Trac delivery person who I saw drive off. Cute camera and so lightweight.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Small profile and easy to use define this camera.  It doesn't have all the bells / whistles and doesn't produce pictures like the $1000 digital SLR, but it is less than $300. I just need something small and light for vacation picture taking with decent picture viewing and this Canon works for me.  The bluetooth setup is also great.  I am happy with this Canon.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I could remove the memory card from my old camera, plug it into my printer and print the pictures that I wanted. I thought that I could do the same with this camera but I can't. It will not let me print my pictures so I don't want this camera. I am so angry that there was no way to know it before I bought it!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The Canon SX420 is an excellent camera. It is easy to use and takes good pictures. The only criticism I have is that in direct sunlight you cannot see the picture you are taking on the screen. It should have a small viewfinder on top.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The quality of this camera is terrible for videos. Photos, it's OK but if you're like me and don't settle for OK then ditch it. It's the kind of camera your mom brings on vacation and thinks the pictures look good. Go for the cameras in the 400+ range with DSLR. That's what I'm doing.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: My second one easy to use carry and work with only thing if your using this for video on same memory card won't print try card for video only. Great camera!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Just received my camera yesterday and am pleased with zoom and other features. However, there is a constant low motor-running type sound when camera is on, especially after zooming (but it does not go away after I have zoomed or retracted the lens).  Panasonic tech support said this is normal.  Have other customers experienced this?  I am surprised it was not mentioned on Amazon reviews or in the 3 or 4 extensive digital camera reviews that I read.,UPDATE:  This is not a noise I can get used too, and when I just shot a video in a quiet room it was amplified on playback.  No one else is mentioning this noise issue so I'm assuming this is defective.  Returning camera today!

review: Very cute, very decent camera, takes great snap shots and really decent high quality video too, the focus takes a little time to get the hang of but once you nail it your golden, comes with a nice carry case to keep it safe and its small enough to fit in a shirt pocket so its super portable just tuck it in your bag and your ready to take snaps everywhere you go .,takes a full size SD card! just so you know and can order one at the same time, battery life is also really good, i was very suprized!

Buy a spare battery or two and external charger (several options on Amazon) and never miss the shot due to a dead battery. They are very small and two will fit in your Sony LCS-CST General Purpose Soft Carrying Case (Also available on Amazon) which has a compartment for spare battery and memory card.

review: Poor design. Batteries drained after 35-40 pictures. Flash in auto mode runs even in bright light. Disabling flash doesn't stay disabled after power down, Video activation button too easy to accidentally hit when pressing normal picture-taking button causing large, unintended use of memory and battery. Actual optical zoom is only 4X with remainder to 8X via digital, reduced resolution so poor picture is unintelligible. Very disappointed.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This camera was purchased mostly to take pictures of rooms in a house, utilizing as much wide angle as I could get.  For that, it did an acceptable job, although I wish it had an even greater wide angle capability.  Resolution is more than needed, so no problem with that, but the lens was not as crisp and sharp as I had hoped for.  But what can one expect in a low-price point-and-shoot camera?  For top quality pictures, I use other cameras, but I didn't have one with interchangeable lens capability, and could not afford to get what I really wanted.  This camera was an adequate compromise, and will be O.K. for my purpose.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: A great little camera--lightweight, easy to handle and set. Good pictures and videos. Really handy and trouble free.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: this camera fell apart within a few months. Admittedly, as a mom of two crazy toddlers, my cameras take a lot of abuse. product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Just got this camera today. I've been shooting video on it and taking photos. I think it's a good quality. Obviously there are better cameras but this is just perfect for what I need right now.Great for the price

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Bought this camera to replace an old snapshot camera. Really like this one! Great photos. Takes pictures quickly so you don't lose that special shot. Good quality too. Telephoto works great and is intuitive. Pull the lever toward you to get closer to your subject, push to decrease. Takes video too although I haven't used it for that yet. Lightweight, slim and compact. Great all around snapshot camera!

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: or snapshots use the auto settings.zoom in on them and you see the oil painting ISO boost artefacts.for perfect pictures go to program mode and limit ISO to 200it is in my pocket or camera bag all the time.for full zoom my shaky grip needs a lightweight tripod but it pays off in buckets.battery life incredible, I only charge it when I am bored!video is amazing for the size and pricethe motion shot function is not a real option, get the app for your phone instead.never use it with phone link or wifi so not much to say.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: This camera is perfect for trips, parties, and really any thing that you would love to have a portable memory of. The pictures are credit card sized and are actually pretty cool because you can fit them into your wallet, but just as easily combine them for a collage or scrapbook or something. Every single place I've brought this thing, it's been a hit, and people love taking instant pictures that they can carry around with them everywhere. Almost like a portable photo booth. The only downside to this camera is that if you use it a whole lot, the film packs can get pretty expensive, and they sort of fluctuate on pricing from time to time. But hey, if a picture is worth a thousand words, then the memories made from the pictures are absolutely priceless!

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Ok some photos are a mass of white or dark but isn’t that part of the art when trying to get the shot. It’s all learning.,This camera is owned by an 8 year old and she loves it. She took the pic in this review as well. It’s a piece of independence and you actually have a physical product for once amongst everything else that’s now digital. Just don’t be expecting iPhone X quality and just appreciate this for what it is.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: My 9 year old loves this camera. We have yet to make prints from it, and the photos look very grainy on the screen at the back, so fingers crossed they come out better than they initially look. The camera itself is easy to use and a nice little item.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: It's surprisingly good for such a small, cheap camera. this to introduce the grand-kids to photography as they are now taking an interst in wildlife and the garden. If anything it could do with being a bit simler for them initially but they learn quickly.this camera is good as a first one for the kids. It is small, probably fairly robust due to its light weight and simple to operate in automatic mode.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: It's not a Sony, Cannon nor is it a Nikon Camera. Honestly, it does not have a name...BUT it does everything that these brand name cameras do. Picture is nice and Video is better. It is small in size and it's perfect if you don't like carrying bulky equipment with you. For the price and the good quality of this camera, I do highly recommend this product from this seller

I like the feature that corrects for camera shake, as I had sometimes had blurry photos with my older camera and this is much improved with the Sony.,Obviously, if you're a serious photographer, this is not the camera for you, but for me, it's great. I like to buy a less expensive camera in case I drop it in a lake or off a bridge by accident, and this seems fine for the price.

Only the memory stick is interchangeable ... luckily I had a spare old one, as none comes with the DSC-W800.,So, I'd prefer to have a NEW DSC-W650 over the W-800. review: It was delivered quickly.  It is exactly what I was looking for.  The pictures look great.

I originally purchased this camera to replace the one that was recently broken, and I'm glad I did.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: We were so pleased to be able to still find a simple digital point and shoot camera for my husband's 87 year old mother!  This is an improvement over her previous digital point and shoot camera.  The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was that the camera requires batteries and our preference would be for a rechargeable camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This product works - but not very well. It must of been built quickly and cheaply - using the Kodak name to impress buyers.,There is an online user manual - but much of what it says is completely inaccurate - and does not correspond to what is actually going on in the camera when you try to change its settings.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Neat little camera - will travel easily - - easy upload to Internet, cable included - wrist strap included - we replaced a much more expensive, older Kodak that gave up the ghost - this one seems to be a good, less expensive alternative - perfect for our casual use.  It will still do more than we need it to do (video, etc.)

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This has become a nightmare. Defective camera does not format any memory card, and after Amazon went to the trouble to send a replacement. I will not buy anymore Kodak cameras, after all the trouble this defective PIXPRO has put me through.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I bought this camera in hope that I got my moneys worth, and got it in time for an upcoming trip that requires a camera. I spent around 60$ on this, and I have never wasted that much money on anything. The box says it was supposed to come with; 2 AA batteries, a Quick Guide Start, a Warranty Card, a Service Card, the camera, a USB cable, and a wrist strap. I got three out of the seven so called 'in box contents.' I am writing this review in hope that no one, and i mean NO ONE wastes their money on this product, and get disappointed and have to write this review. It really was a shame writing this, I heard such great things about this from friends. But, no one should EVER get this product.

review: Easily fits in your shirt pocket. My earlier camera was also Sony, a P200 which was bulkier and heavier. This one is much smarter looking and has a much larger screen and bigger memory capacity for such a small camera. Both take good pics but in low light you want to use the flash to get clear pics. Setting everything on auto including flash is the best option. Easy point and shoot clear pics. But if you are moving around, setting it to 'SteadyShot' may help. A coupla things different from my old camera: the battery remaining time does not show the number of minutes left in each mode. And even when you set the date to 'English' month, it displays the English month only on the screen (i.e., AUG for August) but not on the actual picture's date stamp. This shouldn't be a problem if you don't send pictures to people in other countries where the date format is Day/Month/Year. So if it reads '08 04 2014' they might think it's April 8 instead of August 4. Also, there is no volume adjustment while playing back a movie on the camera. In fact, you won't hear anything at all, regardless of what level you set the volume (the highest level is 4 in Settings). To hear the sound, you plug it into a computer and play the movie.

Terrific.,I might use it once every few months, maybe took a few hundred pictures with it.,Oh well, guess it's a cheap throwaway (even though $100 is pretty damn steep for that).,I attached a pic of what it now looks like when I take a picture as still as I can be.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Camera is small, nice looking and I love the larger screen to view my photos.  It takes really nice pictures and I'm impressed with all of the features.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because it didn't come with detailed instructions for all of the functions.  Just a small brochure to tell you where to put the batteries and a basic illustration of what all the buttons were for.  I had to go to the website and download the instructions, which for me was OK because I have a computer.  What about the people that don't have access to one?  I'm still learning how to use this camera. I bought an SDHC card for it and a set of rechargeable batteries.  The batteries that came with the camera went dead right away.  I must admit that for the price this camera was more than I would have expected. I just hope that it lasts as long as my older 13 year old Kodak Easy Share which I intend to keep for a back-up.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I needed a small compact camera for a vacation that I was going on. I did not want to spend a lot of money on one as I was going to be back packing out in the elements for over a week.,Camera worked great... took pictures very easily and of great resolution. The video on this little bugger is great too.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: MUST READ:,I almost returned this camera 5 minutes after opening because every picture appeared on the screen pixelated and off color slightly. I was so upset because I have an event this weekend. My boyfriend plugged it into his computer to check the settings and BOOM the pictures are perfect! It appears that the screen on the camera is low quality but the camera does actually capture the photos very clear and vivid. So slight downfall with that because when you look through the camera youre disappointed but it does actually work great and very simple for a first time camera owner like myself.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Small LCD screen on camera does NOT do justice to the quality pictures this camera can take. I was very torn when my pictures seemed very grainy and out of focus but as soon as I uploaded them to my computer, the pictures were very clear. I now use this camera to photograph my aquariums and I highly recommend for amateur use. I'm glad the camera is great, just wish the screen was a little more clear.,Side note, my dog did not appreciate the flash!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I just got this camera so it's features and functions are all new to me.  I bought it only so I could shoot pics of stuff I have to sell on Craigslist or eBay.  Actually, the few pics I've taken have been fine.  Be sure to get a SD card with it.  That's very helpful in transferring photos to PC.  If you were to go to the Kodak website for the  owners manuals you could download that and get a more precise idea of all that is potentially possible with it.  It does use batteries up it seems as some have complained.  But I use rechargeable AA batteries so it's not a big problem if one is not out traveling about.  There are a few settings as well within the menus that allow you to turn off energy using options.  Be sure to do that.  Read the OM though; that ought to answer most of your questions.  I've had no mechanical problems yet but I'm in a relatively stable temperature dust free environment.  I cant' say I'd take it out for touring.  At least not yet.  If I have trouble down the road I'll update this review.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Based on all the positive reviews, I bought this to replace an older, similar Canon that worked well for years until it gave out. This is supposed to be a simple point-and-shoot camera, but it is not user friendly out of the box. The first photos I took were awful, blurry, and the flash was wrong. It took forever just to figure out how to override the automatic flash setting which does not work with indoor lighting. I had to look at the user manual online, photography blogs, then play around with the camera to figure out how to adjust the settings. (I had to turn on Blur Reduction and the flash, lower the ISO and adjust the White Balance just to get some decent, usable photos.) It is also difficult to import photos to your laptop. This was a disappointing buy and the return window is brief.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera for shooting video, the lens and quality are great, the price was perfect for what I needed. I only shoot with Panasonic, video or photo and have never had a problem. and that's been for at least 25 years.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Just received my new Panasonic DMC-FZ70 from Amazon.  First thing is that I had preordered it and the price changed by the time I had delivery.  Called Amazon and explained the problem and the very polite lady credited my account with the difference.  It turns out that if you preorder you must call them if the price changes.  They do not automatically credit your account.  Hope this little bit of information will save money for anyone else who preordered.,Now as to the camera itself.  So far I am absolutely thrilled and hopeful.  It replaces an old FZ-7 which still works but the new features and the wide angle on the FZ70 made me want it.,One odd thing is that when the camera is turned on there is a very soft continuous sound coming from the camera when you are doing nothing with it.  So I called the Panasonic support folks and they were essentially worthless and suggested sending the camera back.  I called a local camera store and by luck they had one sitting right there.  The very polite lady listened to my question and said well it shouldn't be making any noise.  Then she turned their FZ70 on and she held it up to her ear and said "oh my golly there is a continuous noise".  Bingo!  With two cameras doing it perhaps then this is normal.  The sound as near as I can describe it is very soft and makes me think of an old coffee percolator that would be in the other room.,So far every feature on the camera seems to work just fine.  I was surprised to see that it was built in China because my FZ-7 was built in Osaka Japan and somehow I had been led to believe that this series was built in Japan.  That is not a deal killer for me.,The weight and feel of this is impressive compared to my older FZ-7.  Fits a man's hand better.,The software that comes with it is impressive.  I bought a Hoya Alfa MC UV and lens protector from Amazon in the 55mm size and it should protect the lens and not degrade the photos.  Bought the Transcend 32GB SDHC. Bought the AGFA Photo Heavy Duty Rubber lens hood in 55mm and that is a bit problematic.  I believe I will keep it for outdoor shots but for flash it is in the way of the distance finder which apparently determines the amount of flash.  Also in full wide angle there is a very slight interference but a slight zoom out from full wide angle and that fixes that. At any rate I will keep the lens hood and just screw it in as needed and not tighten it so it can be removed quickly. To many times in sunlight I find a lens hood to be a necessity., Can't wait to get some pictures and video to see the quality and update this review.,UPDATE:  Still very happy and the quality of the photos is exactly what I hoped for.  The low light capability is excellent and beyond what I was expecting.  Using it mostly in the AI and Scenery modes.  Very impressive.  More capability here than I would expect for this price.  I had actually considered the Nikon D7100 but thought the weight wasn't something I wanted to be hiking with.  More going on inside this little jewel than I have time to understand but wow.  Example is in the AI mode I was using the zoom to take a close up and the symbol on the screen changed to the little flower which on my old FZ7 would have been a setting for taking close-ups of things like flowers.  I will be using it today at a soccer meet with my Granddaughter playing and can't wait to see how it performs.  For this price point you can't beat this camera.,Shot a small video also and used the zoom quite a bit to see how the stabilization worked.  Well the video was better than my dedicated Panasonic HD camcorder.  So I will just be carrying one camera now.,One small thing that I do wonder about is the lens.  Is it a Leica?  Doesn't say Leica on the lens like my old FZ7 and frankly for the quality of the pictures I'm getting it doesn't matter but that little L on the camera body ....always thought that was for Leica but maybe it is for Lumix.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: I've always been fond of Sony electronic products. 20.1 Megapixels yields a ridiculously vivid picture / resolution capability.,I had requested standard 7-10 business day shipping, it came in just 5.,I like how the battery/SD card area is compact.,Navigating through settings is effortless. I appreciate how it came with a temp screen protector to protect the screen until it came into the hands of the new owner. Also included was a basic wrist strap, one battery pack, a USB 3.0 cord to charge with and use on a (USB 3.0 compatible) computer, and a charging brick. But please do not assume it comes with an SD card. Many people do, so be advised and prepare accordingly. If your computer only has USB 2.0, I recommend using an SD -> USB card reader. I still have to.,The battery did not come charged, as expected with electronics, but it charged to full capacity rather quickly when plugged into the wall.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I gave this camera every chance I could to take good pictures.  I studied the manual, I went to the website when I needed help, I hooked it up to my phone, and then I took the same photos with the camera and then my phone, a Samsung Galaxy 7.  My phone won.  The photo of the thunderhead and rainstorm across town taken with my phone showed the colors from bright white to dark gray, creating depth of field.  The photo taken with the camera was overexposed on the bright white areas, showing less definition in the colors and flattening the depth.  Then I photographed the dog, who moves around quite a bit.  The photo with my phone was in sharp focus with good color definition.  The photo with the camera was fuzzy and dull, leading me to conclude that the auto-focus is too slow.  I really wanted to like this camera; I wanted a lightweight camera to take photos on my trip to the British Isles so I wouldn't have to lug around my Canon Rebel XTI.  Unfortunately, the PowerShot SX420 IS was a great disappointment.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This is a utility camera.  If you need something you don't care much about for work, or basic use, it's OK.  I buy cameras like this because I don't want to ruin my phone or a quality camera when I take pictures at work, and as such this camera is more or less adequate.  I think it's overpriced for what it is, but there aren't many that cost less either.,I've gone through a lot of $50-$100 digital cameras in the past years, and for how I use them they never last more than a year, if that.  It's annoying and frustrating, but frankly I am very hard on them and I know going in that the cameras I buy are cheap and won't be very good.,Frustrations particular this camera so far:,1.  Very short battery life, and then the camera just shuts off, doesn't even close the lens if you're in the middle of a picture.  Very annoying.,2.  Every photo comes pre-captioned with text, and this can be a time-wasting irritation when using your photos somewhere.  I have to delete each caption individually when I use them in a Word Press website.  I haven't found a way to change or remove the caption feature, even after reading the online manual.,Photos are what you expect.  Yeah, my phone is way better, but as I said I don't like to use it for work because my hands are often dirty, or paint-y, or resin-y, and I'm not going to ruin my phone that way.  I only use the Kodak camera for work, and would hate to try and use it in the real world.,So the long and the short is that this camera takes pictures that are adequate if you're just doing some sort of rough documentation, but not for family, vacations, or anything in the real world.  I bought it because it's cheap, and I'd had enough of some of the other brands I've tried that continually failed, so I refused to further support those camera manufacturers.,Perhaps I should just buy a cheap smartphone with no calling or data plan simply for the camera use?

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Takes good photos but I like my Kodak Z-5010.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've only had mine a few days so my testing is admittedly limited. Please do not give up on this camera unless you have made some very careful tripod shots. Yes, this camera is hard to hold steady as is any 300+ mm lens. The stabilizer is good but cannot overcome everything. Hand holding 1200mm is a tough job and requires excellent technique and a degree of luck!,I used a heavy Bogen tripod on solid cement and made very careful shots at about 50yds and 75yds (auto focus) throughout the available f range at max zoom. I was quite surprised at the resolving power of the lens using ISO 100.,My Nikon D5000 and Nikkor 70 - 300 EDIF zoom in RAW mode, on the same subject, is barely sharper.,Laugh if you will, but I used the SilkyPix software to examine the RAW and jpeg images. I did not find a difference even worth mentioning in raw and jpeg modes. I did not use the default picture settings in the camera. SilkyPix works just fine if you take a bit of time to learn to use it. I also own PhotoShop and have used it for over 20 years, so it's not like I didn't have a choice.,All images benefited from a bit of post processing just as all my D5000 and P7700 images do.,I can see how some users might easily rush to judgement on this camera. But it shouldn't be about lens sharpness. Hold it steady and it will deliver very good results. Many of the review sites have not done a real good job of testing the camera yet. Buy it and make your own carefully controlled tests, then decide.,Hand held tests at very high magnifications are totally INVALID for lens critiquing purposes. Few people can hold that long lens steady enough. High ISOs will certainly help keep shutter speeds high, but it's the high ISO NOISE then that will ruin the image sharpness .. not the lens.,Use a SOLID tripod to test the long zoom for yourself. Do it at ISO 100 first.,At my work, photographing motorcycles indoors, hand held, under less than optimal lighting, I have used the camera at ISO 1200. Plenty of noise but these images are used at 1024 x 768 (72 dpi) on the internet. The noise at that size and resolution is invisible and the available light shots are quite usable..,The weakness I see and have not found a solution for is highlight clipping. In my tests, light subjects were hard to hold detail in. Perhaps further experimentation with the picture controls may help. Noise seems to creep in early too.,We can't have it all. Twenty to 1200mm is an amazing accomplishment for Panasonic. Remember this is a consumer level camera. At this price point it seems to represent a very good value and a very versatile photographic tool. Perfect? No. None of them are.,My previous Panasonic was an FZ35 which, once I learned to use it properly, was an truly excellent camera. This one probably has a steep learning curve too.,Giving a star rating was hard. With so little testing I hated to rate it yet. Too low ... too high??,My advice is forget the "stars" and test the camera on YOUR own favorite subjects, then decide if it's any good. But, be fair to the camera and be sure any problems you encounter aren't YOUR personal technique problems.,September 30,2013,In the end I just could not love this camera. I wanted to, but I couldn't. I bought it mostly for the long end of the zoom but what I think is a decent lens is hampered by some other factors. Maybe the sensor, maybe the camera software, I don't know. I shot a lot of long zoom photos in bright light and high shutter speeds and for me it just wasn't quite there. High ISOs significantly mar the images after 250. If you do a lot of tripod work maybe this will work out for you. If the lens were "faster" ( like the FZ200), it might be much better, but it is what it is. The combination of sensor noise and slow lens at zoom combine to make less than optimal images when hand holding.,Don't get me wrong, I did get some very nice images from the camera but I had to shoot a lot of frames and be very selective of the images. I'm not saying this is a BAD camera. It just didn't totally please me.,I did like the 20mm aspect of the lens and used in shorter focal lengths I thought it did very well. I'm sure many will find this camera very useful and perfectly satisfactory. I personally will wait a wee bit more for the next round of improvements and try again.,Compared with the really excellent images from my P7700, I just couldn't justify keeping it. DARN! Bottom line is I'd rather have a somewhat shorter zoom with a faster lens and a less noisy sensor that makes better images. I'm gonna miss that 20mm though .....

I've already gone to the park to photograph birds and I could get some great detail of some geese in the water from a considerable distance away. I love the flexible tripod and the cute camera bag that it comes with too. The bag is a little on the small side so it's perfect for travel or to pop in a purse, not so much for all of the additional accessories that the camera comes with. The camera itself is actually lighter than it looks, and it's very easy to use. I haven't tried it in low light conditions but I have no doubt it will perform well. If you're looking for a great bundle, and an even greater camera this is it. You won't be disappointed.

review: Disappointed in the picture quality. Not as advertised. I'm a photog and wanted a quick and easy camera to use on a bike trip.  Didn't work very small (which might be good for some people) but not the quality I'm used to. I used Nikon DSLRs for sports photography and I knew this wouldn't be close.,I actually got better pictures from my Samsung Note 3 during the trip and ended up returning this camera.

review: Just what I was looking for.  Takes excellent photos with dates on and puts them on my internet program easily.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: I received the camera a few days ago and it does everything I need it to do. I wanted an inexpensive digital camera that came with a rechargeable battery (so I wouldn't have to buy loads of AAA batteries), a slot for a memory card, and a flash. I also wanted some sort of image stabilization and zoom. I am still learning how to get optimal lighting so that the flash doesn't drain the color from the image, but that will come with practice. The camera is easy to use, very small but sturdily built and I'm very pleased so far.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)

review: I am not a professional photographer at all, just wanted to be able to take better pictures than my phone could do. I am beyond impressed with this camera for the price it is! So many different features available and such an amazing zoom. I recommend reading the extended instructions that come with the CD to learn some tips and tricks to the Panasonic FZ70 if you're new like me. It's going to take me quite a bit of practice to learn all the functions, but this is a great camera that can simply be used as a point-and-shoot. The first night I got it, I took a picture of the moon and was astounded when I was able to see the craters! Absolutely amazing! I'm looking forward on taking this camera on vacation to capture beautiful pictures of landscapes & family!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

review: Purchase this camera for weekend adventures on the mountain and I must say the quality is amazing very very easy to use well built quality wise, easy to carry around. The bettery last very long time I used it during weekends and didn’t need to recharge it. Very easy to transfers the videos to your laptop. I am surprised how cheap this camcoder is as you get more than you paid for. Very happy I must say and would recommend to friend and family

I like how it comes with a remote so I can set it up and take pictures/video with the push of a button. The screen flips around so you can see yourself too. Overall super happy with this and can't wait to take it on vacation.

review: Great little camcorder for the price.I have used this camcorder to record my baby’s daily life since I received it. It is a wonderful product; it is lightweight, portable, and very easy to use,fits very well in my small hand and nice pictures.Definitely would recommend to my friends.
